Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but think carefully about location if lower manhattan is for you...”
Reviews.Author: kawoh
Reviews.Content: So i'm just reading the reviews post stay and think some have been unnecessarily harsh on the property - some folks I guess take things harder than others. Here's my thoughts and I can be a tough critic sometimes. As a Diamond was upgraded to a Junior Suite on the lower floors (level 5) was told they only have their suites on the lower floors. I thought bah - it'll be a suite, so i'm fine. Actually this was great, because like others have said. My gosh the lifts - they actually have 3 not 2, but yes I can understand why someone could wait 15 minutes for a lift! I always used the stairs - so perhaps if you do have some status go for a room on a lower floor as a suite. Given two bottles of water at checkin. The breakfast in the restaurant was REALLY bad, i mean it's the worst doubletree breakfast i've ever had. The selection was basically hampton inn standard. I was looking forward to an amazing breakfast but was very let down, and the staff in the breakfast room were quite unprofessional, ask if I wanted any juice, I said grapefruit, they said you can go and get it yourself. So much for asking. They also tended just to chatter amongst themselves and how little work they had to do rather than focus on the guests. I thought it was really unprofessional. The checkin staff were very helpful. Location wise - if you want to be in lower manhattan or the business district this is of course ideal, but otherwise it is certainly a long trek up to midtown, so think wisely if this is for you. I found the room very dark and dingey and like others have said the bathroom was like being on a cruise ship it was very small indeed with no space to put anything. The decor was modern and nice and had two LCD tv's. Although asking for a quiet room away from elevators, I guess they compromised and gave me the junior suite. What I didn't enjoy was they put a 1yo kick next door who cried all night and I got very little sleep. Not much you could do. Overall I don't think this is a 'bad' hotel - it's new, modern, clean, but it just has a few rough edges. And sadly because the location was not ideal for me - I'd rather be midtown, but the rate was good and everything in midtown was sold out on a saturday night, it was a compromise. I'd give it a 4/5, but because they really could have done so much better than a hampton inn style breakfast, i'll keep it at a 3/5. If the breakfast was improved it would get a solid 4/5.

Reviews.Title: “the Worst”
Reviews.Author: Julia W
Reviews.Content: This is the lowest review I've ever given to any hotel or restaurants. Please be aware - this hotel will charge you on the rooms that you didn't agree to pay for. I booked a room for two people last Christmas. Even we had only two people to stay in that room, the front desk offered us a double bed room. We rejected the offer, and we have 6 people to testify that. However, the hotel still put on the wrong charge and would not refund us the money. They had no evidence at all that we agree to change the room. It is an ILLEGAL and IMMORAL doing of the hotel. It is stealing money from the customer. Please, please, please don't ever stay at this hotel. I know this hotel has the lowest rate on Priceline, and that was how I fell into the trick. If they don't rip you off this time, they will find a way next time. I'm escalating this issue to Hilton. if there's any change, I will update the review.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, hassle free stay.”
Reviews.Author: London_Andy
Reviews.Content: I arrived later than planned due to a cancelled flight, but the check-in was smooth. I asked where the nearest 24 hour drug store was and showed them my map which they had never seen before - which surprised me as it showed all the subway stations and bus routes in lower Manhattan (go to the MTA website, then Maps, then Lower Manhattan map to get it). I chose the hotel due to the price (c. $130 per night) and although it isn't close to many of the sights, many subway lines are on the doorstep, particularly the 4/5 going up the East Side, and the 1 going up the West Side. The room itself was fine, on the 40th floor, with a view over the Freedom Tower which was nothing special, but at least I wasn't looking at a brick wall out of the window. The bathroom was clean (but only had a shower, no bath) and the bed comfortable. Only once out of about a dozen times did I have to wait more than a couple of minutes for the lift. I stayed for 4 nights, and had breakfast in the hotel each day - on the Friday morning there was a line/queue and I had to wait for about 10 minutes, but the other days I could sit down straight away. I got free internet access as a Hilton Diamond member, but otherwise I would feel a bit ripped off having to pay $10 per day - many peer hotels give it away free these days. All in all a good hotel, and I would stay there again if I could get the same price (it seems that I must have got a particularly good deal compared to the normal room rates).

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment Abounds”
Reviews.Author: Angela W
Reviews.Content: The Good - Nice location in reference to the client and Stone street for restaurants. Rooms are clean, modern, and quiet. The Bad - Small rooms equipped with a bathroom which reminds me of being on a cruise ship. No room for toiletries, unless you consider the top of the toilet as viable space. If you are facing any place other than a concrete wall, expect wind noise. Hallway is TINY, so there really is not a room "away" from the elevator, so bring ear plugs. The Could Be Better - The elevators are horrible if you are on a higher floor (above 10). Please include 5-10 minute wait, especially since the cleaning and maintenance staff will pile in with you. the restaurant will be backed with tour bus participants, be prepared to wait or grab a Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant in quiet end of NYC”
Reviews.Author: nomad401
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Doubletree in the Financial District with my partner for 4 nights at the end of February. We booked the hotel through a mystery hotel deal and didn't really know what to expect. Upon arrival (we were very delayed due to a delayed flight in) the staff were very friendly and welcoming which was a welcome suprise given by that stage we looked like a pair of scruffy backpackers and not the business clientele it felt that this hotel caters mainly for. Our room on the 14th floor was compact but not as small as some of the rooms I have had on previous trips to NYC. There was a king bed, desk, armchair and bathroom, all that could comfortably fit 2 people. The cleaniness of the room was excellant and it was nice to be away from the hustle and bustle of uptown Manhatten (made for a good night's sleep) while being within a couple minutes walk from the subway. Staten Island Ferry terminal with a view of the Staue of Liberty, was also only a minute walk away. Very good housekeeping and in general very impressed with the service, comfort of the rooms (very good beds) and cleaniness. Will definately try to book again on our return trip to NYC next year.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly Decent but a lot of room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: fdawgvt
Reviews.Content: First off i will say we got a great deal on this hotel off of hotwire, but for a four star hotel it was not as nice as i wouldve expected. I think all of the comments on the reviews about the elevators were overstated. There are three elevators and it wasnt that bad, just get on the elevator when you see it (even if its the wrong direction). Its much easier going up than going down, they are heavily weighted towards the lobby and ground floors. The room is small but most are in New York. It wasnt cramped and there was enough space. The bed and furnshings were quite nice and comfortable. The room was clean when we started and cleaned well each day. My biggest complaint was the noise from our neighbors, not necessarily a mark on the hotel but we could hear everything. We stayed for five nights. Our first two nights the couple next door was loud and obnoxious and smoked one of the nights. When we called the front desk security promptly came and checked on the room. Our last two nights our neighbor made a business phone call at 5:30 in the morning, which we heard every word of. Street noise was minimal. The walls were very thin. The location wasnt too bad, its near the ferry to Ellis Island and statue of liberty as well as the 911 memorial and the stock exchange but most major landmarks are uptown. Its near three or four different subway stops that are good avenues for getting around the city. The free cookies were a nice gesture although sort of commonplace around the country nowadays. Overall not bad, but i would probably try and stay somewhere else (unless i got another great deal).

Reviews.Title: “Lux Softness on Stone”
Reviews.Author: teraflop
Reviews.Content: Drove down FDR, ambled through circuitous routes in the Financial District, then parked across the street. The kindly doormen helped explain the 2nd-floor entrance where I was rapidly booked in. The lobby looked warm, inviting, and was soon in my room on the 40th facing the East River. TV was great as I relaxed from later long jogs and walks in the frigid winter air, and despite the business in the lobby, the room was quiet. The subway basically at the end of the block but as long as you can walk, there's something to see in the environs (Battery Park, Staaten Island ferry, walk/jog to FDR drive where I headed up to 10th street on a run), and the ubiquitous monuments/paens to the Financial District (been there, done that). Would return.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Ann J
Reviews.Content: 44 floors two tiny slow elevators. 10 rooms per floor five abut elevators that ding constantly. Hallways are very narrow. Rooms tiny barely room to get suitcase in. Rooms look good but very low yellow lights. My room 910 had ventilation from outside bringing in orders of meat at night and at 5 am coffee & bacon., then cigarettes. Would never, ever stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel - Quiet and convenient”
Reviews.Author: EricL97332
Reviews.Content: The room was small but very nice. Bed was comfotable. Room was quiet (no street noise for us). Bell man was also helpful. We enjoyed having an after dinner drink at Murphy's next door and suggest trying the 'Baby Guiness' before going back to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice oasis in lower Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: leesh96
Reviews.Content: This Doubletree finds itself right in the middle of the financial district in lower Manhattan. It's a very convenient location not too far from most of the major subway lines. In my case, I booked 2 rooms in advance for an extended family getaway over weekend. The weekend advance rates were very inexpensive for Manhattan and is a great way to stay in NYC for cheap! Check in was quick and friendly. Our connecting king rooms were quite tight (normal for Manhattan) but were laid out in a nice configuration. The bedding consisted of the updated Hilton sheets which were very comfortable. The furniture and the room were all very clean and sported a very modern zen-like feel. The bathrooms were very clean and modern looking. The water pressure was strong and showers felt great. All the usual toiletries were included, shampoo, conditioner and lotion. I had 2 slight issues with the hotel rooms. The HVAC was not as quiet as it could be and all the ice machines were out of commission during my stay forcing me to ask the connected restaurant for my cubes. (They said there was some defect in all the machines - hopefully this will be resolved soon) The morning breakfast (included as a Hilton Diamond) was average for a Doubletree. (which is decent) A nice touch is that they included Hilton Diamond breakfast passes for BOTH of my reserved rooms. All in all a good inexpensive and enjoyable weekend stay for my family.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable NYC hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmcbalt
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in the financial district. The price was very reasonable, particularly since I was staying over a weekend rather than during the week. The breakfast buffet was plentiful and good. Easily reached by foot or using public transportation. Was upgraded to a room with a gorgeous river view. The room size is about average for NYC hotels -- small but well-appointed; same for the bathroom. The lounge area near the front desk was very comfortable and generally quiet/calm once the morning rush had passed, and the small business center functioned well. My only complaint is about the noise my neighbors made: they propped their door open to make entry by other members of their group simple, and seemed to forget that not everyone on the floor was interested in their plans or opinions.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with very nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: dapfunk187
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at the Doubletree in the financial district. We got this reservation through Priceline at a great price, but after my reservation was confirmed, I called to ensure we could get a double bed...that is when they told me I would have to pay $60 more to have a double room since apparently Priceline doesn't guarantee that. That was a bummer, but there was nothing we could do about it. Just keep that in mind if you use Priceline for NYC hotels (this has happened before to us but only in NYC). Upon arriving, we found a parking garage right across the street from the hotel that was about $15 cheaper than valeting so we were happy about that. The lobby is really nice with lots of plush couches. At check-in, they gave each us a warm cookie which was SO good. Such a nice welcoming gift :) We got a room on the 43rd floor which had a great view of the new tower being built near Ground Zero. We were really pleased with that as we got some great photos. The room wasn't very big but it had everything needed plus was very clean. The bathroom was very nice, but small as well (to be expected in NYC). The financial district is very quiet during the weekends which was nice. We felt safe and got a good nights sleep on the comfy beds. One other thing to mention is that the hallways are very very narrows so it's almost impossible to pass someone if you are coming through with luggage. It can be very uncomfortable. Other than that (and the extra price we had to pay), we had a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Best NYC Hotel that I have stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: madsin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on the Presidents Day holiday weekend, just for one night, and found it to be the best hotel I have stayed in in the NYC area so far! The hotel is in the Financial District, so is away from the hustle and bustle of Midtown. On the weekend this area was very quiet. The hotel is in a great spot, with the red and yellow subway lines just 2 or 3 minutes walk, and the green line not much further. It is also 5 minutes walk from the Staten Island Ferry, and just across the road from Battery Park. I used my position at this hotel to walk around some areas of NYC I hadn't explored before. The museum of Jewish History is a 10 minute walk, and the World Trade Centre Memorial maybe 15-20 minute walk. The hotel itself is nothing much to look at from the outside, but inside I found it to be clean, and very nice overall. The check-in desks are on the 2nd floor, which is kind of a pain, because you have to catch the elevator 1 floor up and then get off, and then get the elevator again to your room. All staff I encountered were very friendly - the girl who checked me in was especially friendly. On the weekends they give out warm chocolate chip cookies on check-in which was nice, and they gave us an extra one when we came back in at midnight when we asked for one! They were really yummy! Our room was on the 6th floor. We didn't have a view of anything other than the building behind us, but for the price we paid ($115 for one night, including taxes) I wasn't really looking for a view - just a clean place to stay. The room was small, but for NYC standards it was average sized, I'd stay. The king bed was AMAZINGLY comfortable, and they provided 5 pillows of differing firmness which I liked. Bathroom was clean and modern. Other people have complained of it being too small, but I'm not sure what they want to do in their other than shower! It was perfectly fine, however we had to call down to reception for a box of Kleenex as they did not have any in the bathroom. We didn't eat at the hotel as it was rather expensive. There is an Au Bon Pain 2 minutes walk, and also a Duane Reed around the corner. The only thing that blemished our stay at this hotel was that the housekeeping staff were very loud, and barged into our room not once, but 5 times between 9am (when they woke us) and 11:30am (check out was noon). I thought after the first time they would leave us alone, but they kept coming back. It turned out that our "do not disturb" sign has fallen onto the floor, but as well as the constant barging into our room, they also yelled loudly in the hallways outside our door, and constantly slammed the doors of the rooms they were cleaning. I found this to be rude and wasn't very pleased with it on a Sunday morning when I wanted to be able to sleep in a little. Overall it was a great trip, a great hotel and I wouldn't hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and a Good Value”
Reviews.Author: goodegg5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my husband's birthday weekend last year. The hotel is very nice, clean and even though it is in the financial district, it is still close to great restaurants like Delmonico's and great pizza places. We had a blast and will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, adequate room - ask for a high floor river view room”
Reviews.Author: riocobb
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week in December and found the hotel to have everything you would need. The rooms and particularly the bed was extremely comfortable, however the bathroom is small. The staff were responsive and attentive and did all they could to make the stay pleasant. It should however be noted at peak times ie morning and early evening the lifts are a challenge as there are not enough for the number of rooms so there can be lengthy wait times. There is a gym however this is small and again not catering to the number of rooms, and twice I went there and every piece of equipment was in use. The Hilton rewards points are a plus, and it is in a quiet location, so you do not get the normal noise you would get in NY. When you check in ask for a river view high floored room as the view is AMAZING!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Polished”
Reviews.Author: roachcoachtravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on the weekend, stayed in the finance district to avoid the noise of tourists. It's very good value, everything is a subway ride away with the R train just steps away from the front door and the 4&5 around 1 block. Plenty of places to go out for a relaxing night nearby at the seaport. Rooms are cozy but spotless. Bathrooms are well updated and equipped minus a hair dryer though. Plenty of TV channels like some 100+ available. The 3 elevators were OK at best, at 44 floors it can build up at the bottom and since the lobby is on the 2nd floor you have to wait twice to go down. WiFi is free only in the lobby, $10 charge in the room. Breakfast package is available but is $30 extra, and the a la carte menu is quite pricey, $12 for cereal? There is Duane Reed 100 yards away with beer, much better value than the hotel bar. Overall the hotel was clean and good value, but when you add things it does get pricey quick.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, comfy bed, great decor, abysmally small bathroom”
Reviews.Author: akovalcsik
Reviews.Content: So let's get to the bad stuff first. The bathroom (just a shower) hardly enough room for one person, so just think how difficult it would be if two were to try to squeeze in! The main issue being the shower is glassed in and there is a handrail bar taking up most of the room. This is the worst part, it only gets better from here! Spacious room (for new york) with an absolutely comfy bed, free cookies in the lobby, friendly staff, great area (close to the 1 line). The area is very quite on the weekend and there is hardly any traffic, plus you're within walking distance of Battery parking. Highly recommended except for the bathroom, but the price was hard to beat for this time of year. The only other complaint was the paper thin walls, but I think that's par for the course in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here, but, solo women, do not dine here.”
Reviews.Author: smg608
Reviews.Content: Very clean, comfortable, away from frenetic midtown, the hotel was a plus. My review is particularly for solo women traveling. I felt safe, staff professional and helpful. Attaining a taxi can be tricky as Stone St. is quite isolated. I had bellman assist . Due to the snowstorm in Jan., some restaurants on Sat. evening were not open in the area. I decided to dine in the hotel, as the icy sidewalks outside concerned me. I called for an 8 o'clock reservation . Arriving in the dining room, it was busy with one side filled, but tables street side were open. The small bar had a few. I was led to the BACK room where breakfast is offered. When the hostess led me there, it was vacant. Many tables, but empty. I looked at her and said I would like the front room, and her reply was there a private party. Hmmmm. Servers were attentive, food was very good, cocktail excellent. I did see the servers bring many dishes of the same food out to the dining area as well as the same dessert. So, there was a private group. But, after a really fast dinner, in a completely empty room, feeling banished...I saw some of the tables street side occupied with people obviously not part of the party. This really raised my ire. I travel fairly often solo, this has never happened before, and I will not allow it to happen again. The hostess disappeared, there were no management people around to discuss my dissatisfaction. But, if this hotel wishes to cater to women business travelers, or any woman alone, this should not be tolerated ! Hilton Corp. take notice please.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: M C
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business travel. The hotel is easy to find and near the office I used to work in. The staff were very courteous and the warm cookie when you check in is a nice touch. I booked through my company and not sure if that contributed to my being upgraded but I ended up with a king sized bed suite. The room was very nice and clean with plenty of room to walk around even with the large bed. There was a desk to work and closet space. Also a chair to watch TV. The TV was a nice flat screen hung on the wall which didn't distract too much. Also had a small pod machine to make either coffee or tea. The bathroom was modern and well stocked. I ate in the restaurant one evening and it was passable. Not the best meal I've had in NY but it was good for when I didn't feel like going outside the hotel to eat after a long day. My only complaint is that you have to get up EARLY to make sure you get water for a hot shower. The first night I slept until 7am and even after running the water for 20min it was still ice cold so I had to suck it up. This hotel seems popular with the business travel crowd so I guess mornings during the week tax the hot water supply. Overall, I would stay here again the next time I have overnights in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Heart of the Financial District”
Reviews.Author: Melissa45582
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to stay in the heart of the financial district, this is a good hotel. Around the corner you have the Wall Street Bull, View of Statue of Liberty and Wall Street. Walking distance is Ground Zero Memorial, Brooklyn Bride and Chinatown. The hotel lobby is on the 2nd floor and first floor is a restaurant. Front desk offered us good welcoming services and a warm cookie. The room was typical small NYC room, but nice and clean. Only downside, was slow elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel away from the noise of NYC”
Reviews.Author: fuzz021
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel in the financial district. You are away from the hustle and bustle but this is easily accessed by the subway station which is just across the street. The beds are huge and the noise from outside is minimal. The staff were friendly and helpful and the warm cookie on arrival is a nice touch. The wi-fi is only free in the reception area which is a shame. There are a nice selection of bars and restaurants in nearby old Stone Street. We stayed at this hotel at the beginning of our trip and for one night towards the end. We wish we had stayed here on our last night as the noise from outside in busier areas makes it hard to sleep. This is a nice, clean hotel which location wise is great if you want a good nights sleep.There are only 3 lifts for the whole building and you do have to wait around for one but we were not in a rush so it was no problem.

Reviews.Title: “would happily stay again”
Reviews.Author: Paul M
Reviews.Content: We moved from a hotel at Times Square after about a week, to the Doubletree, as we wanted to experience downtown manhattan, and get out of times square for new years. The lady who helped us when we dropped into the hotel to enquire about a reservation went out of her way to be helpful, and accommodated a corporate rate for me, which was excellent given it was over New Years. the hotel itself is very new, and very nice, rooms are quite large for New York. Internet worked well. would agree with others comments to get a room away from lifts as hallways are a bit narrow. also we found housekeeping to be a little noisy outside out room in the mornings when we had do not disturb on the door if we'd been out late the night before. The lifts only caused us an issue one morning, and this was when one lift was out of service, so understandable. Our biggest gripe about the hotel was the breakfast room was far too small for the number of guests trying to use it, resulting in a queue to be seated in a hallway near the bell desk that was too small. I would suggest they don't sell breakfast inclusive rooms, as the facilities cannot accommodate it - that said the breakfast we had there was very good, and the staff did their best with the size of restaurant they had to work with. Checkin / out was very easy, and the bell guy helped us take the hotel dab to the airport which was convenient. close to subway, walking distance to staten island ferry, good restaurants and bars close by the hotel, Duane Reid convenience shop and murphys bar are right next door. all in all, the good far outweighed the bad, and we would happily stay here again, and would highly recommend it. don't buy the breakfast if you are in a rush, and allow time for the lifts just in case.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: ajhodges0
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for twixmas between 26th and 30th December. Good location for Liberty Island & Staten Island ferries, also Financial District and Downtown generally. Numerous subway lines very close by with one access in Stone Street itself and nearby streets near Wall Street are heavily policed so it feels very safe. Chipotle mexican fast food nearby. I was never sufficiently tempted to try the hotel restaurant which generally seemed mildly expensive and quiet. Breakfast was not included in the deal I got from the hotel. Hotel room seemed an unremarkable 4* city hotel room. The bed seemed shorter than I would have liked and I am not that tall at 5' 10". The major issue with the hotel is the elevators or rather the lack of them. I find it difficult to conceive the building was designed as a 44 floor hotel with just three elevators in total and wonder if it was originally intended to be a hotel when it was built. My waiting times varied from nothing late at night to six minutes at peak times and this during a period the hotel was presumably not that full. On my last day one elevator malfunctioned bringing the number of working elevators to two and I later overheard another guest loudly complaining to the Manager regarding the elevators, which I suspected was not that unusual. Also reception is on the second floor and I found late at night that anyone can walk in off the street and use the elevators since late at night there were often no staff in the lobby, which seems to be something of a security issue. My last day alarm call failed to materialise but service was otherwise okay. Finally if you are going to visit midtown a lot as I found I was, the 15-20 min subway journey begins to tire and is not ideal, particularly at night. So unless you want use use taxis frequently, a hotel closer to midtown would probably be better. I suspect I'll stay in midtown next time.

Reviews.Title: “Had a fun Time”
Reviews.Author: Barry C
Reviews.Content: Thanks to All the staff for the friendly and welcoming way treated us. I

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: trojansoldier
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal on Priceline for a two night stay during the Christmas holidays. Room was very clean but on the smaller side; we got by since we didn't have too much luggage. Looking at many of the reviews, we feel we got lucky with the elevators as we never waited more than 2 mins. But I can easily visualize the bottleneck since they don't have a separate service elevator. That apart the location is good even for tourists. Brooklyn bridge, staten island ferry, 9/11 memorial etc are within a short walk. There are multiple subway stations within a couple of minutes which will take you to midtown in 15-20 mins.

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: Amylynnus
Reviews.Content: This hotel has serious management problems. My husband and I recently stayed there and came back to the hotel one night at about 11:00 pm to find the entrance blocked by a group of 50 German tourists waiting to take the ONE working elevator to the reception area on the second floor. There was no way for us to get to our room on the 40th floor without walking up the stairs (or waiting about an hour in a very small doorway behind the tourist group until an elevator was free). The German tourists weren't any happier. This was an inexcusable inconvenience but one I was somewhat prepared for since I had read the reviews on tripadvisor. When my husband and I finally got to our floor (yes, we walked up 40 flights), we entered the room to find it had not been cleaned even though we had been gone all day (from 11 am). I called reception for someone to come clean our room and was told it was impossible to have someone clean it until tomorrow because the cleaning staff went home. So I asked if I could have some towels so we could take showers before going to bed. And they said yes but it would take awhile since there was a crowd in the entrance and only one elevator working. So then I demanded a refund for the room but was told that they couldn't do anything until the housekeeping manager checked with the cleaning woman in the morning to find out why she didn't clean the room. The staff overall were very nice and helpful but it seems they are operating under rules and conditions that make it very difficult for them to ensure customers receive the service they deserve. Unlike any other hotel I've stayed in, they don't seem to have an organized system to check in large groups, have a pitiful housekeeping set up, and yes, a problem with their elevators. Other than all of this, our room was small but adequate and the bed (on the first night) was very clean with nice sheets. But I won't stay here again. And I probably won't stay at a Hilton again, either.

Reviews.Title: “One night for business”
Reviews.Author: HoustonConsultant
Reviews.Content: Had a last minute business meeting, so had to book a hotel near the financial district less than a week out. Not surprisingly for NYC, the price was $300+, even for the AAA rate. I only have basic elite status at Hilton, so I knew I was not likely to get a nice room, and given the relatively small size of most NYC rooms, I expected this to be small. I did not expect exactly how small it would be. The basic fundamentals of the room were fine. The bed was comfortable, the shower was hot, and the TV worked. However, there was no room to even up the luggage stand for my bag without it being in the way, and I was in the room alone. Also, the air conditioning works on an IR sensor from the thermostat on the wall. If you have anything between the thermostat and the unit, you cannot control it. As the room got down to 64 degrees, I finally called maintenance. They quickly came up and explained what was going on, but keep this in mind if you struggle to control the temperature. Breakfast in the hotel was fine, and there is a nice Italian place directly across the street. It was a long meal, but convenient to get to. Overall, I am sure there are some larger rooms at the hotel, but the room I was in seemed small even by NYC standards. Iâ€™m likely to stay here again on business, but Iâ€™ll look to see if I can find something else first.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: LivPhilly
Reviews.Content: Hotel is one year old - clean/fresh. Every single staff person was helpful and friendly. Ask for a map as this area has lots of tiny streets you will want to explore. The price of $139.00 per night (I paid $101 on Priceline) is unbeatable. Upon making reservations, I asked for a quiet room away from ice maker/elevator and was given Room 402 - next to the ice maker/elevator. Within minutes, my request for another room was honored (no snarky looks/comments), and I settled into Room 602 - perfect. Room 603 is a favorite, too. There are 40 some floors. Lower floors offer faster exit, but are closer to street noise; higher rooms are quieter. Entrance to hotel is on the ground floor next to Doubletree's restaurant. Take the elevator in front of you to 2nd floor for reception - beautiful sitting area/computer station. The location is superb. 8 Stone Street is on a tiny portion of Stone St. At least six eateries in this little section - Asian, Mexican, Italian, Irish. Cross Broad St. (out the door, turn right) and Stone Street continues! Walk along cobblestoned streets with little shops, restaurants/bars. Financier Bakery (Stone & Mill Lane) has delicious pastries & coffee reasonably priced at $1.90 med. Further along, lunch for $6.95 at Cafe Sage (Thai- fresh/delicious) at 108 John St (between John & Gold St). You can WALK to all sights - Battery Park, American Indian Museum - 1 Bowling Green (free), 9/11 Memorial (get passes ahead of time & go at 4:00 or 5:00 - no crowds & the memorial is something to experience at night), World Financial Center & Winter Garden Building - a huge glass building/mall/offices ideally located to view Ground Zero - you will know you are in Winter Garden when you spot the palm trees (ask a security guard for easy walking directions from Memorial), Trinity Church, Wall Street, Staten Island Ferry (free 1 hr. trip to view Ellis Island & Statue of Liberty, departs every 30 mins from 4 South St), and for shoppers - Century 21 Department Store (22 Cortland St between Broadway & Church). If you want to leave the Financial District, it is easy to take the subway (about a 15 min ride to 42nd Street and Times Square area). The Financial District area is very safe 3-5 police officers on seemingly every block - they not only offer security, but great directions! You will be happy to return to Doubletree and try out the comfortable bed. Lots of hot water (no tub), good ac/heating. Negatives - shame on the builders for not properly insulating this new hotel. Shampoo/soap/coffee creamers are not replenished by maids even during a three day stay.

Reviews.Title: “I don't know what everyone is complaining about, I loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Spice-O-Life
Reviews.Content: The location was great, the elevator was HARDLY a problem, the staff were wonderful and the room was NOT tiny, in fact, it was a great size. You've gotta love the warm chocolate chip cookie at check-in, and the rooms have all the amenities you'll ever need, including a STARBUCKS coffeemaker. That's what I call top notch, none of that bitter hotel stock coffee. And the beds are wonderful. I didn't try the restaurants, but hotel restaurants are rarely very good unless they employ some exceptional chef. Don't worry yourself about the elevators, I don't know why everyone makes such a big deal about that, the longest I waited was about a minute and a half. It's a big building people, what's the rush to go up and down??

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good location to subways and local bars and restaurants”
Reviews.Author: PaulaW0150
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews before I went, as always some people are harder to please than others. I only ever waited a minute for the lift, there were 3 lifts and they seemed very quick, no real issues there. The room was very nice and clean, just a little small but didn't spend much time in the room and the bed was big and very very comfy and the shower was really good, bathroom also small but perfectly acceptable. The maid came in every day and made up the bed, cleaned and left fresh towels which I was very impressed with, she even folded our night clothes neatly on our pillows. We also got warm cookies on arrival which my 14-year daughter absolutely loved and they gave us more on checkout. My only criticims was there isn't much space in the room to leave/store your suitcases and the aircon was a little noisy but we were so tired from all the walking anyway. I would stay again, thoroughly enjoyed the hotel, the area and New York.

Reviews.Title: “New York, New York!”
Reviews.Author: Diana D
Reviews.Content: The staff was awesome! From the front desk Michelle, Anthony and Jesse you guys made checking in very smooth and accommodated all our request. The bell men Naamen, Hopton and Chris, were friendly, helpful and gave us great directions on how to get around the city. From the restaurant Felix, Frank, Haasan, Giovanni and the manager Scott, the food was great and the service was excellent! There were a few people from House Keeping but I did not catch their names. We would definitely stay there again. From Your Miami Friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean rooms, but elevators are huge problem”
Reviews.Author: jaredaggie
Reviews.Content: This is a good clean place to stay. It is close to two convenient subway stations. The rooms are clean and decenly sized. The problem is the elevators are HORRIBLE. I waited at least 20 minutes, multiple times for an elevator. I'd keep looking if you're staying during a busy time. If however you want/need to be in the financial district, this is a great location, just avoid elevators during peak times.

Reviews.Title: “Nice NYC hotel just a bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: NJCathi
Reviews.Content: I've lived/worked in the area in the past and knew that the financial district was not going to provide any restaurants or other amenities particularly on a weekend, but I was ok with that. This was a reward stay for me, so I was more concerned with saving points than being closer to Tribeca or Midtown. The staff was very nice, the room was a little bigger than normal NYC hotel rooms I've experienced and well-appointed. Good hot water in the modern bath with a walk-in shower which I much prefer. The bed was very comfortable with plenty of pillows. Good flat screen with cable. Only downside was that wifi was not free so I passed on that. The elevator issue has been mentioned by just about every previous poster and I totally agree. I was only on the 9th floor but even with the lower floor, I had to get on an elevator going up to actually get downstairs when I was leaving. Three elevators for a 44 story building is just not cutting it at all, particularly when the lobby is on the 2nd floor. Parking was available at the garage directly across the street for only $35 per day - a total bargain in the city! The Bowling Green subway station is only a block away so the R was easy to reach. Taxis are also pretty abundant.

Reviews.Title: “lack of elevator remove the positives”
Reviews.Author: aussiekiwi_boy
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms are nice and very quiet, the restaurant food was fantastic. However, I will not use this hotel again - there are just three elevators for over 40 floors, and you will wait, and wait and wait. Over twenty minutes each time - pretty disappointing

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, great view, poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: Anialw13
Reviews.Content: I have had an opportunity to deal with this hotel twice in the last month. Once was through a travelocity booking and while an issue arose and I called to speak to the manager on duty, she was rude, would not listen to my full complaint and ended up hanging up on me. While I am not stating that she should have done as I wished, her job was to at least hear me out and offer solutions or follow up by her managers. In all honesty, I cannot remember when is the last time I was treated this poorly by a manager, especially that it was quite easy to track her down as this was not the call center. I did finally get a call back from an assistant general manager after I called twice. He was polite and did hear me out, did not exactly address the original issue but did offer me breakfast. The rest of the staff while dining and checking in was very nice and pleasant. I unfortunately had to stay another time in a few days as this hotel is very convenient to my office and the rate was fine. The room in and of itself was very clean, well set up, and the view of the river was superb. It was nice to relax in the morning and look outside. The overall hotel is space challenged as many NY hotels are, so the hotel lobby is actually yon the 2nd floor. This hotel has 44 floors and only 3 elevators. Trust me that this is an issue. If you know you have to be somewhere on time, add from 5 to 10 minutes just to get on the elevator. If you are on the top floors you ride down is not too bad since you get on first, but if you are anywhere below the 30th floor, you may have to let many elevators pass you in order to get out of the hotel. Additionally, the restaurant for breakfast while a buffet, I cannot believe people would pay $18 to eat this as it is basically oatmeal, potatoes, eggs and bacon. It was good, but extremely cramped and you basically had to stand over people whose chairs were right by the buffet. I know the place is small, but the set up will need to be rethought. In general, I will probably look for other accommodations while in the financial district if New York. Sorry Double Tree, I gave you a second chance.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: DCbella85
Reviews.Content: The rooms were small, but impeccably clean. The area is quiet and not too much is going on around it (by NYC terms). Good place to stay in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Slow Elevaltors”
Reviews.Author: rescue2823
Reviews.Content: I was not impressed by this hotel. Went on business for 3 nights. Great location to the South Street Ferry or subway lines. Spent $429/night for a king size room. No bathtub, only walk in shower. The shower faucet was coming loose and the hot water wasnt impressive either. The cable was a plus but had a hard time getting it working at first. The air in the room was tough to control since it was very small. Elevators are terrible. For a 40+ story building, 2 elevators are not enough. Should have read the reviews on foursquare first. Now everyone knows. Either stay at a lower floor and take the stairs or be prepared to wait. 15+ minutes at times. The extra money i used was to pay for breakfast at the hotel. Do yourself a favor, take the extra $20 and go get yourself a good bagel. Buffet is nothing to be proud of. I am not staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: willempostTheHague
Reviews.Content: A hidden gem in the old part of the Financial District. Clean, tasteful decorated and a very good restaurant. Liked their tuna salad. Reasonable price for the room. One of the best hotels in lower Manhattan. Great staff! I will definetely return. Subwaystation a one minute walk (R-line to Canal Street, 34th, 42th Street etc.).

Reviews.Title: “FrequentNYC Traveler”
Reviews.Author: Diana K
Reviews.Content: First of all this hotel was advertised as a 4-star, which I think should be lowered to a 3-star. That said, let me start off by saying the 3-elevator situation for a 44-story building is totally absurd. There was never a time when we did not have to spend an inordinate period of time waiting for an elevator. Fortunately we were on the 5th floor and could use the steps, but my hubby was suffering from a sore foot and this was a painful experience. Additionally the hotel service personnel are forced to use the same 3 elevators, which further burdens the already over-stressed system. The rooms are well appointed and clean, but we actually ran out of toilet paper and asked the maid working in the next room for some. She responded that she would get us some, but half-hour later when we asked again, she went to the supply cabinet and reported that she was out of toilet paper and would have someone send us some up. Fortunately we did have tissues in the room. But 4 hours later when no toilet paper had arrived, I called the desk asking if I had to go out and buy my own. They apologized and promptly hustled 2 precious rolls up from the main supply. The final straw was the group of young girls in the adjoining room (our room had a connecting door to the room next door) who woke us at 4:15 a.m. with loud shrieks, laughs and claps. Finally, after 15 minutes of partying, my hubby knocked on their door and asked them to quiet down. They did for about 5 minutes, but then reverted back to their previous behavior. I had no idea that you could hear noise from the adjacent room so clearly through a closed connecting door, but we could actually hear every word of their conversation in addition to the vomiting of one of the girls. This was followed by traffic back and forth in the hallway and hotel room doors slamming as they must have had additional friends in other rooms on the floor. Apparently others were awakened by this wee-hour partying and I believe that the hotel staff took control of the situation by sending someone up after an hour of this nonsense, as we heard no more from them after that!! Needless to say this disrupted what should have been a good night's sleep before a busy travel day! Travelers, beware the rooms with the connecting doors!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Rissa0401
Reviews.Content: this hotel is located in the financial district... great location to subways and ferries and walking distance to WTC Memorial Site, shopping in SOHO and of course Century 21. We received a pretty good deal on the Hilton website. Some food places are closed on the weekends but that is expected since its the financial district. Valet parking is $50 but we opted for self-parking $35 which was right across the street. The concierge recommended one that was a block away, same $35 price. Overall, staff was hospitable, a warm cookie is always a treat after a long day of travelling. Room was clean and modern, small but it is expected, bed were comfy. I read reviews before booking and I knew that the elevators took a long time, especially during check out time. The longest we waited was maybe 3 minutes or so. The bed was comfy.. but the only con was that it was a bit noisy - we were directly across from the elevators so you can hear people waiting for the elevators (hallways were pretty tight), the ice maker was pretty loud and at times you can hear the other guests in the other room. Internet available only in lobby and entrance floor. They have a nice comfy lobby where people can sit and surf the internet. But overall, good hotel for the price in nyc. I would stay there again. I love staying in downtown nyc area.

Reviews.Title: “Best price vs quality in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: tonydagreat1
Reviews.Content: This hotel features a great staff, impeccable rooms (I am a first-class germophobe and I had nothing to complain about), and great location. I will stay there again even if I have to cab it to Times Square, it is worth it. If you have to do business in Brooklyn, do not stay in Brooklyn but stay at this location. By car/cab, you will be in Brooklyn in 5 minutes! Cons : Rooms are a bit small, but what would you expect in NYC? Really not a problem If you are staying on the last floor (I requested it and they kindly accepted), you might hear the elevator motor during the night, but it is understandable and it will not keep you up for sure. Overall : 9/10 (and I rarely give any hotel more than a 8/10)

Reviews.Title: “great price and location”
Reviews.Author: onhar
Reviews.Content: For a Hilton hotel in NYC, the price was great! and the service too. It is close to the ferry and subway stations. The room was nice, clean and quiet. It's fun to walk around too. The only problem was the elevator, it takes forever to arrive but we were on the 42th floor, so no way to take the stairs! Plus, it was difficult to find the hotel as they were located on a street without sign name. So, we spent at least half an hour walking around to find it. Every person we asked had a different explanation of how to get there and the map wasn't very helpful. Loved their warm cookie at the check-in desk

Reviews.Title: “overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: mmc9
Reviews.Content: Also bid on Priceline for about $140 which we felt was a great price for NYC. Room was nice, clean and efficient. Only problem we had was luke-warm shower in the morning. Every staff member we encountered was very friendly and willing to help. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, Nice location!”
Reviews.Author: Chimango
Reviews.Content: The room is big enough and comfortable. It has a King bed with incredible linens. The bathroom immaculate and clean. The shower is little small, the shower hear big and it felt awesome! The elevators: OMG...it takes forever to arrive and if you get the local, forget it...very disappointed. The buffet breakfast is worth the extra $10 a person. Get it!!! Over all experience is great.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for overnight, close to ferries, ellis island, statue of Liberty”
Reviews.Author: wavewatcher
Reviews.Content: We Bid on Priceline for an overnight stay 11/11/11, so didn't know which downtown hotel I would get, but felt lucky to land the Doubletree for $140.00. The hotel was built in 2010, so it is clean and modern. Rooms are big enough for a king bed, and chair. Bathroom compact, mine had walk in shower, no tub. One small glass shelf for toiletries. Blowdryer under sink, plenty of towels. Bed linens fluffy, clean, comfy. I would not choose this place for more than a few days, because I think it would start feeling small quickly. However, it was the closest hotel to Battery Park (3 short blocks) where we went for a wedding. Also very close to ferries for Statue of Liberty, and just beautiful to see her out in the harbor, from the park. This is an old, and quiet section of Manhattan, lots of history on those cobblestone streets. Yes the hotel elevators are woefully slow, but the friendliness of the employees we spoke with earned an extra star.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for Marathon weekend”
Reviews.Author: FL-Alyssa
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel so I would walk to the Staten Island Ferry to get to the Marathon. Location was great. Even though it is very downtown, it is very quick to get around on the subway with two stops only about a block away. It was also nice to be in a more quiet area of town with all the people in the city that weekend. The hotel amenities aren't bad. Rooms were clean and comfortable, not huge but not many are in New York. The elevators were not super fast, but I also don't think we ever actually waited more than 5 minutes for one.The staff was very friendly and accommodating. We ate at the restaurant the first night and they had decent selection and food was good. On the other side of Stone Street there are bunch of cute bars and restaurants. We ate at Adrienne's Pizzabar twice. Overall it met my expectations and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Live with the quirks and you'll be fine”
Reviews.Author: georgecleveland
Reviews.Content: This big Lower Manhattan hotel is convenient and comfortable. Every single member of the staff seemed to go out of their way to be pleasant. And the pleasantries seemed sincere, not forced. For me that's half the battle. The subway is close and cabs seemed frequent even though Stone St is tiny and out of the way. And it's close to a number of good restaurants. Yes it's true, getting IN to the Doubletree is kind of a fascinating experience. You have to go to the second floor. And I think there are only 3 elevators for the whole place, so sometimes you wait a bit. But they're fast. The room was compact but well thought out and LOTS of plugs. If you want to pay a bunch more, maybe you'll get more. But if you want a pleasant and comfortable place in that part of town, you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad....”
Reviews.Author: Wyliegal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well situated for me workwise and it is a good deal for the price. Like everyone I am frustrated with the situation with the elevators which is not something that is going to change. I have stayed here before and felt that the room was not as clean as it should have been this trip. This hotel is used by a lot of tourists from France who get a package that includes breakfast. The line up for the morning buffet breakfast stretches out into the hallway which is very frustrating at 7am for someone going to work. As a Hilton gold member I am given vouchers for the breakfast and think there should be an area for frequent Hilton guests to get the breakfast buffet without the rediculous lines. I just went down there at 9am Saturday, after a 20 minute wait for an elevator that had a huge service cart in it, only to find at least 30 people in line for breakfast.This line up also blocks very narrow entrance and exit so you have to fight your way out the door. I am supposed to return to this hotel next week and am now wondering if that is a good idea or not.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and nice”
Reviews.Author: E J
Reviews.Content: A good hotel. Was pretty much spotlessly clean, comfortable beds, very helpful staff. Really nice breakfast. Good location for a tourist. Seemed expensive, but then so did everywhere else in NY! There was a bit of corridor noise (ice-machine clunking away in the corridor), but I lways travel with ear-plugs anyway.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: Nortguy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week. The hotel is modern and very clean. The staff is excellent. The hotel's location is ideal for World Trade Center, etc. visits. Our room was very comfortable and a good size. Breakfast was excellent. Many good restaurants located in the neighborhood. Close to all major subway lines. The much-maligned elevators could be faster, but were not a big problem for us. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, no wifi, slow elevators”
Reviews.Author: 1philb
Reviews.Content: This Doubletree is in a good location if you have business in the financial district. The room were clean. That ends the "good stuff." My room was small even by NYC standards, there was no wifi in my room, I had to go down to the lobby to use high speed internet. There were a limited number of elevators and they were very slow.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT bed!”
Reviews.Author: stardust49
Reviews.Content: On the trip to the city I realized we were going to be late, so I called them to ask about late check-in -- they said cheerfully it was no problem; and in fact, checking in at 6 pm on a Saturday was easy....personnel were fast and courteous. The Welcome Cookie was absolutely delicious, a big, chewy chocolate chip affair.... The room was small, but stylish. It was very clean, permanently non-smoking, no cleaning solvent odors either. Some effort has been made to be a little "greener" than a lot of hotels -- there were recycling bins for bottles and cans; the toilet had the Little Flush button and the Big Flush button.... The bed was definitely King-size in width, but it was only standard in length....necessary, I think, given how narrow the room was. But the mattress was perfect in terms of firmness; there were lots of pillows; and the linens were downright luxurious. There was a very plump mattress pad, high thread-count sheets, and TWO king-size down comforters....we only needed one in the event. I could happily have stayed in bed for days..... The narrowness of the room meant that the TV on the wall opposite the bed was fairly close....great for watching from bed! The coffee machine (Wolfgang Puck) actually worked; made two cups of decent coffee at once, and there was real half-and-half to put in it....though there needed to be quite a bit more of that..... The take-out food from the Mexican restaurant across the street was inexpensive and delicious. The breakfast nook, on the other hand, left a lot to be desired. The light is cold and very, very gray. The food arrived not QUITE stone cold. The music, on a Sunday morning, was top-40, not at ALL what one wants to hear during breakfast, AND it was too loud. They were, however, still SERVING breakfast at something past noon, so that was good. The other main flaw was the lack of elevators. There were only two elevators for forty-some floors, which meant that you had to wait a long time for an elevator, and then, if you were on one of the lower floors trying to go down, probably you couldn't fit in when the door opened because it was chock-full of people who had gotten on higher up. Luckily, we were on the 32nd floor, so while we had to wait to get a down elevator, it was at least not full when the door opened. There were no Do Not Disturb signs for us to hang on the door handle of our room, and the next morning....Sunday.....Housekeeping knocked and knocked and called and called at 9:15 until I finally had to get out of bed and ask her to Go Away. Management should either give guests Do Not Disturb signs, or else not send Housekeeping until after check-out time, which was noon. All in all, though, I would go there again.....the neighborhood is very nice, and the Landmark Customs House with the Smithsonian Museum of American Indians in it is WELL worth visiting, over next to Battery Park....no entrance fee! Lexington Ave. express subway is right there, too, so getting uptown is easy and fast.

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree-Occupy Stone Street”
Reviews.Author: MDFriars
Reviews.Content: Very modern and well-appointed hotel in the middle of the Financial District of NYC. Great location for anything downtown, but be prepared for a scarcity of restaurants on weekend nights. Practically everything was closed during our Saturday-night stay. It really didn't matter, as the service at the hotel more than made up for our need to walk a little for good food. The elevators (3) were slow given the need to service 44 floors. Again however, the service was outstanding, so much so that the wait was more than bearable. And don't get us started on the cookies---same as it ever was!

Reviews.Title: “Long waits at the Doubletree - Financial District”
Reviews.Author: Joel T
Reviews.Content: New Doubletree Hotel in NYC's Financial District is well-located and has nice staff, if small rooms. The problems are the crazy-small entrance area (the lobby is on the second floor) that is frequently impassable due to people- and luggage-jams, and the elevators. Three elevators, that hold about 8 - 9 people, serve a hotel with hundreds of rooms! Those same elevators are being used for room service and housekeeping. We often waited 10 minutes for an elevator to arrive and one morning 20 minutes. Every guest of the hotel that we encountered was talking about this. If you don't mind walking up and down two or three dozen flights of stairs anytime you want to go to or from your room, this is the place for you! Otherwise, book elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Short beds”
Reviews.Author: disport
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable. The beds are slightly shorter than most so I had to sleep slightly sideways, usually this is only a problem in Hong Kong. The beds though are extremely comfortabale otherwise. Looks like the "09" rooms on the high floors have views of the water so ask for one when you book a room. There's also no minibar in the rooms so if you feel like a beer after a long day no luck, you need to order from room service or head down to the bar, though I'm told this is common for NYC? The lobby is on the 2nd floor so you have to walk through the smokers area by the front door to get to check in. The internet is extremely slow. Summing up it's clean and a good location for Wall Street and work. I wouldn't want to stay there for a personal holiday though.

Reviews.Title: “Best in price range”
Reviews.Author: MLC1234
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on business a few times. And for the price range I think it's the best in breed. Masses better than the Club Quarters and on a par with (but much cheaper than) the Guildhall. Yes the elevators are very slow. On occasion they forgot to clean my room. The TV router freezes and needs a reboot. And the rooms can be small. But it's clean, well decorated, close to the Stone Street bar and restaurant area and it's fairly quiet (ask for a room away from the elevators).

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but hard to find”
Reviews.Author: EngineersWife
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in October, 2011. I had to show the cab driver where it was on my map. Even the front door was hard to find. (When you are facing the hotel, it is to the left.) The lobby is on the second floor. Never had to wait too long for an elevator. I arrived in the morning, but was able to check my bag and walk around the area. Very close to two subway lines, Trininty Church, and the Wall Street "bull". Rooms are small (typical for NYC). Air conditioning worked great, bed/bedding were wonderful. Completely neutral scent; housekeeping did a great job. The bathroom was obviously designed for looks, not use. No counterspace (sink sat on top of counter with about 3" on both sides). No bathtub, which was fine, but the showerhead was the large "rainshower" type which is difficult to direct to rinse the soap off, and there was no ledge to rest your foot on to shave your legs. Also, when you open the shower door, the water runs off the edge, soaking your bathmat. Only one hook on the bathroom door, so kind of hard to dry more than one towel.

Reviews.Title: “Good but...”
Reviews.Author: SunshineStateGuy
Reviews.Content: Great location if you need to be near Wall Street. The rooms were clean and fairly decent. Views were nothing special and the rest of the hotel was about average. My biggest gripe was with the elevator system. There are only three elevators to service the entire 44 floors. And the staff has to use them too! One morning it took me twelve minutes to use the elevator. I would have taken the stairs five minutes in, but I was on the 33rd floor, so it would have been quite a workout. I don't see how this problem can be resolved aside from an entire remodel of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location, great for business, hard to find”
Reviews.Author: 1kunited
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Doubletree in the Financial District on a recent business trip to NYC. The hotel itself was great -- decent sized rooms, adequate workout center (not huge, but adequate), decent restaurant, great location. Next door to an irish pub, near some good restaurants, walking distance to subway, etc. I would definitely stay here again. The only downside was that the cab drivers don't seem to know where it is -- one cabbie actually had to call the hotel to get directions.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to mark”
Reviews.Author: Klingc
Reviews.Content: Am still staying in the hotel as my company did a block booking of about 30 rooms for 2 weeks.note that basic toiletries like shower caps, toohthbrush or toothpaste are not provuded. Housekeeping did not clear the leftover hair in the shower stall. My room is small, with barely any counter space at the sink for toiletries. Massive long wait for elevators. Forget about the buffett breakfast, eat elsewhere. Internet acces is charged at $10 per 24 hours, which is atrocious for a financial district hotel. Will not recommend to any friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for NYC financial district”
Reviews.Author: pdx-engaged
Reviews.Content: Check-in was friendly, asking if my companions wanted to be on the same floor. Room was more spacious than I was expecting, as most NYC hotel rooms are TINY. I may have lucked into a better room, as my co-worker said hers was small. Close to good dining, and their breakfast was good. Only downside was slow, snobbish service at the bar. C'mon, people, we're business travelers looking for a nice drink with good, mellow service. They were quite rude, so avoid the bar and take your alcohol budget elsewhere! Otherwise, the stay was fine. Pricey, but most of NYC is, so get over that, and look at location and service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with NYC challenges”
Reviews.Author: gmead7
Reviews.Content: For the unindoctrinated, NYC rooms tend to small in comparison to typical hotel rooms. These rooms were small, but made excellent use of the space. My room was extremely clean, comfy bed. Notable about this hotel is the number of TV stations provided - I was thrilled with so many choices - well over 100. I did require some assistance in getting the TV started up, but after getting walked through it one time, this was not a big issue. The shower was extremely nice - excellent large, sized shower head and the controls worked so that you could leave the temperature to whatever you like so it starts up at that temperature on your next shower. I loved it. Now for the not so good. The elevator system is simply not up to the task. In NYC, it is not uncommon to wait 5-15 minutes for an elevator - you just need to be patient as this is the way it is in the big city. However, on my last day there, I waited a good 15 minutes plus and no elevator ever stopped. I finally gave up and carried my suitcase down 17 flights. I was glad I wasn't going up. I asked around a bit on my exit and the sense I got is that this seems to be an ongoing issue. (I was told that an elevator was "out" and also observed that a large group arrived the night before and were meeting up on the street. I also heard that some were waiting over 30 minutes for an elevator). Despite a very nice room, I only rated this a 3 out of 5 as elevator service needs to be up to par with whatever the capacity of the hotel is and the feel I received here is that it definitely is not. In short, business travelers need to reliably feel that they will be able to get to their appointment on time.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, but...”
Reviews.Author: kmntgm
Reviews.Content: Nice room, new furniture, good breakfast. The location is also great for exploring the financial district, Battery Park, South Street Seaport and historic Stone Street. The only real downside is the extreemly slow elevator service. There just aren't enough elevators for the number of floors, so you might be waiting a while to get up or down at busy times of the day or night. Otherwise, we were very happy with the hotel. Great, quick service too.

Reviews.Title: “May be OK for mid-week business, but not so for weekend pleasure.”
Reviews.Author: brjake
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife and adult daughter for two nights. (Fri, Sat). There was a two night minimum. A junior suite was $975 for the entire stay. This junior "suite" was the second smallest room I have ever stayed in, and I thought it would have been alright for three adults, but it was pretty small. We scoped out the web site and parking is listed as $35 or $50 per day if you self park or use the valet service, The garage they use is around the corner and across the street (on S. Williams St.). There is a garage right across this narrow street that charges $35 a day! It is probably 50 feet from the front door of the hotel. A 200 mile drive in the rain got us to the hotel at about 10:30 PM and we were dog tired. There were no sheets or pillows for the sleep sofa so we had to call the desk and ask for them. It is not the end of the world but those things should have been there before we arrived. When the room was made up after the first night just two towels were replaced. The corridors are short and narrow and none of us have trouble sleeping but there was a fair amount of noise in our room from the elevators and other guests coming and going and some light sleepers could be put off by this. There are three elevators for 44 floors so some long waits will occur from time to time. The registration desk is on the second floor and we went there three times, once to register, once to check out once to ask to request late departure and that request was readily granted. The staff was helpful and friendly. The room was insanely clean and the cable tv service had more channels than I have at home and in HD, too. There is a pub right next door and some other restaurants very close including Starbucks and Chipotle Mexican Grill in addition to the on site dining options. The Bowling Green Subway station is about 100 yards and can get you uptown in no time, Battery Park is a short walk from here and the World Financial Center is a long but pleasant walk from here. The worst parts of this trip were the tininess of the so-called suite, the forgetful nature of housekeeping regarding three adults but supplies for just two and the two night minimum but a lot of NYC hotels do this on weekends. The best parts were the cleanliness and proximity to the subway. If you drive consider the parking option across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good and Excellent FiDi Location”
Reviews.Author: oli-business
Reviews.Content: If you need to be the in Financial District of NYC and don't want to throw your money out of the window, stay at this Doubletree. The prices are VERY reasonable, the rooms are spacious (for NYC), the gym is great, staff is nice & friendly and the downstairs restaurant is also very good. Seriously, I have nothing to say against this hotel, except that the Internet access is slow during peak hours. Else, it's a GO without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “good choice, more relaxed area”
Reviews.Author: Grantie
Reviews.Content: We were pleased we chose to stay in this area. It was a nice area to walk about. Shops and restaurants nearby, battery park for jogging and a subway stop in the street. It was a bit of a ride to get to some of the places you may want to go but we also walked to a lot of places from the hotel. The staff were friendly. Yes the elevators are a pain but its not the end of the world if you have to wait a few minutes for and elevator. There were big queues for breakfast on the Saturday morning which we just avoided but I would not have wanted to wait 15 minutes to be seated. There was a good business centre with PCs and a printer, helpful for boarding passes. The rooms were small but perfectly formed with very nice bathrooms and great showers. My son was unwell on our last day and staff very kindly let him stay in the room until 3pm. I don't think you can go far wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, a bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelto_11
Reviews.Content: I was staying in this hotel for 1 night only, on a sort of stop over. It's very nice, feels new, and the rooms well kept up and clean. the rooms have a shower only. The rooms are small, but this is New York! You are not going to spend a huge amount of time here! The only downside is the location... It is at the southernmost tip of Manhattan!

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel experience in Financial District”
Reviews.Author: DocAllOverTheWorld
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by the DoubleTree Hotel in the Financial District. The hotel itself is clean and modern, and the service was superb. Our rooms were spacious for NYC with all necessary amenities and a terrific view. I was very happy with their complimentary breakfast. Lastly, I was very glad I picked this hotel in this area as most people are turned off at the idea of staying in the Financial District on the weekends. However, with all of the outdoor dining on Stone Street and a renewed effort to make that pocket of NYC interesting on Saturdays and Sundays, this place seemed like a steal. My only complaint was that 3 elevators aren't enough when you're on the 39th floor of a busy hotel. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A b(i/u)g inconvenience”
Reviews.Author: rachel c
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed a night at the Doubletree in the financial district. My experience was interrupted by an uncomfortable and disconcerting incident; while my cousin and I were sleeping in the bed, we got bitten by something, most likely insects, all over our bodies. Specifically, I went to bed at around 11pm and after showering and getting into bed, my cousin was complaining of bug bites and itching, but we did not see anything in the bed, few hours later I awoke itchy and with bite marks on my arms, hands and legs. At that point, (3am) I told her to quickly get out of bed because there was something (potentially bed bugs, I assumed) biting us. I immediately went to the lobby to report my problem at which time they switched our room and told me return at 8:30am to speak with the manager. Without even focusing on the manager's skeptic and rude attitude towards me, I can just say that from here, I was offered no answers and min compensation. The manager had a inspection company come in the next day and inspect the room and told me that nothing was found. 'Nothing' does not bite 2 people in a hotel bed all over their bodies. No further explanation was offered and one can ponder whether or not a large corporate hotel would ever admit to having such a problem to a client. Regardless, if the Hilton mission statement is "to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality" and that mission extends to the Doubletree brand, the financial district branch has fallen terribly short; instead they've produced emotional and psychological frustration and physical discomfort (in my case). Its not enough to tell a loyal and paying customer, 'we do not know why this has happened to you' and shrug your shoulders of the situation. As compensation, Manager Murnane offered me a complimentary night at the Doubletree (why would I want to stay in an environment where I do not feel safe or comfortable!) This situation that has left me feeling powerless and voiceless. I don't know why I went through the trouble of showing an employee and manager the bite marks, having documented the bite marks with photos, to subsequently be offered NO answers concerning the origin of the bites. It is disconcerting that they claimed to have had a professional come in and inspect the premises and yet have found NOTHING. Bug bites do not arise out of dust and I surely did not spend the extra bucks to stay at the Doubletree to have the sort of experience you would expect from Motel 8.

Reviews.Title: “Nice newer hotel in financial district”
Reviews.Author: Laurancn
Reviews.Content: Fairly new hotel on Stone Street in the financial district. Rooms are nice but small. King size bed is about all that fits in the room. Bed is very comfortable. This hotel was completed in 2010 so everything is new. Had issues turning on the TV with the remote (not the only person having the same issue) Maintenance guy said they were going to change the way the remote connected. That was probably the biggest issue. Fitness room was decent. 3 treadmills, 2 ellipticals, & 1 bicycle. Some free weights, bench and a universal. Enough floor room for mat exercises & stretching. On the corner is a Duane Reed drugstore that has a lot of "fast" foods, i.e. fresh fruit cups, sandwiches, yogurts etc. Along with your normal goods in drug store. Across the way was a Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, nice but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: gromoe
Reviews.Content: Despite being evacuated due to Hurricane Irene, our experince at this hotel was great. Staff was super friendly and very helpful. Rooms were quite small but new and nicely appointed. Elevators were small and a bit slow. Free breakfast was marginal at best.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but could have been better”
Reviews.Author: hatifnati
Reviews.Content: The hotel sits at the tip of Manhattan in the Financial District. Great location, right by a subway station and within short walk of Battery Park. The hotel was clean and pleasant. It is tucked between other buildings, so what it lacks in floor space it makes up in height. The floors are very small, with only a few rooms per floor. We were located on the 30th-something floor with a "city view". The real view is pretty poor because of other high-rise buildings in front of it, but it wasn't truly awful. I wish we picked "river view" though. The room was very small, but it was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom only had a shower, which was a challenge with 1.5-year-old toddler, but we made it work. Some toiletries were missing, like shampoo. Halfway through our first day, the elevators broke (or needed maintenance or something) so only a couple was operating. Frustrating in a hotel with over 40 floors, you had to wait a long time and then the elevators were packed. We were also supposed to get complimentary chocolate-covered strawberries due to our Hilton HHonors status and they weren't there when we arrived. We had to inquire with a manager. The breakfast was was good, but nothing out of ordinary. Overall, despite some speed bumps, it was a good hotel. We would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great property, excellent staff in an accessible location”
Reviews.Author: wroddick
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Doubletree on a last-minute deal from Priceline. I arrived at the hotel WAY ahead of check-in (about 9am) on Labor Day weekend (with the hotel apparently being completely sold out the night before) and was in my room by 11. The reception and management at the property were great during the entire stay and even allowed for a late check-out on what was clearly a busy day for them; surprisingly enough, the manager actually remembered my name as I made the request at the desk. Room itself was immaculate although the rumors of the "bathroom fan Poltergeist" are true; it does seem to turn off and on as it pleases, but I didn't really notice it outside of the bathroom. The elevators, as others have previously described, can be a bit of an annoyance with regards to wait time, especially during checkout periods. It's certainly not enough to keep you away from the property though, and I'd recommend the place to anyone. The staff were EXCEPTIONAL and the location is hard to beat if you don't mind a short commute into Midtown.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and property! We will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: japa34
