Reviews.Content: Everything about this property was outstanding! Right from the moment we checked into the hotel we were treated with the best of service. The room was nicely appointed, clean and everything we could ask for. As for the location, it was absolutely perfect. The quaint pubs, restaurants and bars of Stone Street were only steps away. At first, when I booked the Doubletree I wasn't sure if staying in the financial district was a good idea but I was definitely wrong. There is very much a night life in this area. When we return to New York we will most definitely stay at this hotel. Thanks Doubletree for making our stay in New York a memorable one!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location. Long waits for elevators.”
Reviews.Author: m4drudy
Reviews.Content: The staff at the DblTree were very accomodating. I had gotten a great rate by booking online and using a Hilton Honors code. I saved about $60 a night. The room was on an upper floor - very clean, totally what I expected - the wait for the elevators was crazy though. Thirty minutes to get from the 15th floor to the lobby. Would have taken stairs had it not been for luggage! They have a concierge service that gave pretty good directions. Overall the location was ideal as we weren't very far from a subway and battery park was within a quick walk for ferry to Statue of Liberty

Reviews.Title: “Won't be staying here again”
Reviews.Author: Barabra E
Reviews.Content: Not all bad, but bad enough to not stay here again. Pros: - We got turned around tryinging to locate the correct parking garage and our GPS kept losing the signal. Called the hotel and Robert stayed on the phone until we found our way. Very nice, very patient, and gave very good directions. - Accomodated our early check-in request. - Room was clean and tidy. - Didn't pay for a river view, but that's what we were given. - R train is across the street and you can get the 4 and 5 train within a couple of blocks. Cons: - Three elevevators for 44 story building. And the elevators were tiny...fits maybe five adults, without luggage. - The lobby is on the second floor. This only creates added use for the few elevators. Even though there were more pros then cons, it was enough of a hassle to not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: jvalente_ca
Reviews.Content: Wife and I traveled with our 2 boys (8&12) and stayed here for 2 nights. I had some hesitations about staying in the Financial District, but it was a very smart decision to stay here. The room, it's NYC!... so it was average size with 2 double beds - VERY clean, A/C worked great, bathroom was modern, clean with good water pressure. We showed up at 12h30pm and our room was ready, had to wait a few minutes at the lobby as there was only 1 staff member, but when the manager noticed 3 people standing & waiting to be served he came out from the office to help out. The lobby is on the second floor, TAKE THE STAIRS and walk up to check-in, park your car direclty across the street(mention you are staying @ hotel and they will honor the $35/day). We had NO problems with the elevators, most we ever waited was maybe 3-4 minutes. Breakfast was included with our room, it is a good breakfast Hot & Cold, bacon/pancakes/eggs/fruits/cereal/juice/coffee/danishes/croissant/yougurts/etc. I strongly recommend talking the breakfast option, a breakfast like this in any hotel in any city is easily +$20. The staff, friendly, accomodating, no 'attitude'..make you feel like they appreciate your business and you being there. One of the men working on the main floor actually ran to the street corner to get us a taxi! The best part of this hotel is it's location and here's why - NYC is C R A Z Y busy & noisy so when you get back from your day out visiting busy TimeSquare/Cental Park/Rockfeller Center or wherever else you can actually relax and unwind and let your mind rest from all the noise & activity of the city. Financial district during weekdays 8-6 is busy like everywhere else in NYC, if not more so - but after 6pm everyone goes home and on weekends it's quiet for 2 days :) Anothe BIG advantage of staying here, you walk 50m to the corner of the street and you have 2 subway stations. This is what we used to get around with our kids, we took the GREEN number 4 to Grand Central Station/Time Square/ Yankee Stadium. If you have any worries about taking the subway as I did, there is TRULY nothing to worry about - as mentioned we traveled with our 2 boys and not only was it safe and people VERY friendly & willing to help with directions, but the subway wagons are CLEAN!!! Th whole city acutally is pretty clean considering the number of people there...only rude people you will find are other tourists, go figure! I will DEFINETLY stay here again - great service!,clean room! friendly staff, fantastic location, and cheap parking(for NYC) P.S. A cab ride to Little Italy $7 / Century 21 dept. store 10min walk / Statue of Liberty ferry5 minute walk / cab ride Rockfeller Center $14. Don;t hesitate to drop me an email if you have any questions JValente_ca@Yahoo.ca

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way, even better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: kristenstravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree this past weekend and it was perfect! Since we were only going to be in the city for a short time, we checked to see if by chance, we could check in early and change after a 3 hour drive. Otherwise we would have had to in the car! Sam was working at the front desk and graciously checked us in with out a problem! at 9AM! It was a huge relief. He was extremely friendly and helpful and went above and beyond to help us with our car parking situation we had with a lot that was not affiliated with the hotel. Thanks Sam! You are an asset to the hotel. As far as the elevators, it is clear to see, if you look on the map of the hotel, that they have as many elevators as possible given the layout of the hotel. We never had to wait more than a minute or two, not a big deal at all. I don't have a ton of patience either. For those complaining about the layout of the hotel (having to go through the restaurant?? Seriously, figure it out) You come through a bell stand area, the restaurant is to the right of it, through glass doors...it's not difficult to figure out. Then you go to the second floor to the lobby and to check in. I don't see how anyone could complain about this but I guess some people will look for anything to complain about. The hotel's location worked absoulutely perfect for us. We walked about 5 minutes to Battery Park to get the ferry to the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island, WTC Memorial was about 10 minute walk and the subway to get to Times Square was just 5 minutes away. Saturday night Times Square was absolutely crazy, as expected, so we came back and just had a couple drinks at a quiet little Irish bar right next door to the hotel. It was great! The room was perfect and what you would expect for NYC-it was actually better than I expected. Beautifully appointed with all the necessities! We couldn't have chosen a better hotel for our stay in NYC, would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “perfect for the traveling couple...”
Reviews.Author: julesinjersey
Reviews.Content: Pricelined this hotel for a quick city overnight. Very happy with location, walking distance to South Street Seaport, Battery Park, and the Staten Island Ferry (free boatride!). Also right down the street from a delightful cobblestoned section of restaurants and bars, also on Stone Street, heading East. The street is blocked and has community tables in the middle, very European! (Hint: there is a building standing in the middle of Stone, you have to walk around it.). Hotel itself is small, yo they have very few doubles, but you can ask for a king. NO ROLLAWAYS...we brought a rolled up foam mat for my son and used the extra pillows and down comforter from the closet. Hot chocolate chip cookies on check-in; very clean room with a huge flatscreen and four HBO channels, really helpful staff down to the guys at the door, and simply everyone else. Free internet on three computers in the lobby, no charge to hold your bags in storage. There's a Chipotle across the street and the Native American Museum, nearby, is free. Downside: Elevators can be slow, but were generally quick and the continental breakfast isn't free for some room levels (we went for a diner one day, fast food the next). Really enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant place to stay”
Reviews.Author: HappyHops
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights on our first nights on a trip to America. Hard to find reasonable priced hotels but decided we would give this a try. Lovely new hotel, fresh, smart and comfortable room, staff friendly and very helpful. Tube very close by which is excellent for travelling to other parts of London and of course Statue of Liberty is very close by. Agree with comments about the lifts, but really its not a huge problem. Had wonderful nights sleep, beds were lovely, after a long flight. Also thought the gym was pretty well equipped and although wi-fi is chargeable in the rooms, the business centre there is convenient and a last internet connection. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Janice1024752
Reviews.Content: I had a great time in this hotel. Allthough it's not in Midtown the location is great if you want to see the statue of Liberty (as we did) and only in town for a short while. We had booked a family room but were placed on the 33rd floor which was too high for one of the family members. The front desk responded quickly to get us to one of the lower floors however the carpet there turned out to be wet. Again Michelle and Sara came with solutions and giving us a free upgrade to other rooms! Please make sure to make use of the Waterstreet diner as well. Again LOVED this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “NYC deal”
Reviews.Author: TheHef
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business because of the price and location to Wall Street. There is not a lot to do after dark but a cab ride and a few blocks later young some great places to eat. The hotel is pretty low key and on a quiet street. There is a hole in the wall across the street that sells awesome lobster rolls for lunch but get there early because the line is huge. If you know about NYC history you are in the oldest part of town. Cool stuff if you like that sort of thing.

Reviews.Title: “Great for one night get away”
Reviews.Author: Anaps
Reviews.Content: We are locals who spent a night away from the kids and the Doubletree was perfect for us. Yes the elevators are slow. The rooms are smaller but clean and new. We had no issues with the front desk or the cleaning people disturbing us. The beds were comfy and everyone we encountered was really friendly. Keep in mind we didn't spend much time there. Not sure if I would choose this for a week long stay but for the most part it was clean and comfortable for us. Plus its hard to find anything under $200 that halfway decent in Manhattan!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: traveler629_11
Reviews.Content: Location is awful for a weekend when you're looking for things to do with family. There is not much around besides Liberty Island and it is hard to find a cab. There is nothing worthwhile on Stone Street - it's dirty and unexciting. The hotel is extremely cramped and small - don't stay here if you have claustrophic tendencies. The hallways, elevators, guestrooms and bathrooms are SUPER tiny. Most importantly, customer service was terrible. I took a risk by booking on Priceline and this was the cheapest hotel I could find. Now I know why... Immediately after booking (1 week before my arrival) I contacted the hotel to request one of my two rooms to have double beds. Anthony at the front desk told me they were "almost 50% occupied" and had "plenty of doubles and even suites left." He needed me to contact Priceline with the request and have them fax over a request - which I did immediately. When it came time to check in, Sam informed me that the request was not granted and they are now out of double rooms. We also requested a refrigerator for one of the rooms (for medication), which was not mentioned anywhere in the reservation. He was unhelpful, unaccommodating and unsympathetic... and let me know that the request - that they "NEEDED" from Priceline to grant my request - is merely a "request" and not guaranteed. Even though they were less than 50% occupied only 1 week before and had plenty of space when the request was submitted. He also let me know that they do not have any other room types or rolling beds available. He also said he'd send the refrigerator up right away... and 5 hours later, it was not there. Not only was it not there, nobody at the front desk "had even heard that we were looking for one" and by that time they were out of them. It took them about another hour to dig one up and bring it to our room unenthusiastically. With all five or so employees we interacted with, all were unenthusiastic and unhelpful. It was a bad experience and I will make sure never to stay there ever again, and try to avoid all Doubletrees in the future as well. Summary: DO NOT STAY HERE. Many more hotel options with friendlier employees and larger rooms/hallways/bathrooms throughout the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great altenative in the Financial District”
Reviews.Author: Big_D_in_LAS
Reviews.Content: If not for Stone Street being so short the hotel would be easy to miss. The rooms and bathroom are smaller than normal, but clean and updated. Street noise does filter in when the air cuts off, but not loud enough to keep you from sleeping. I will be staying there again on my next NYC trip.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to say it was a good experience”
Reviews.Author: trumpedfinally
Reviews.Content: Lot's of issues with our stay at this hotel. Firstly, we were out of the room from about 9 am to 3:30 pm except for a lunch break. When we returned at 3:30 the room had not been cleaned. I went to the front desk and told them I was going to take a nap and that I would be leaving the room at 6:30pm and could the room be cleaned then. I was told that housekeeping leaves at 5:30. At 4:30pm I awoke and called for towels. I was told that housekeeping had informed them that we had a do not disturb card and therefore the room could not be cleaned before they left. I found a note placed under my door sometime after 3:45pm stating that housekeeping came by but that the room could not be cleaned that day because they leave at 4:30pm. We had 4 rooms booked at this hotel and there were multiple similiar incidents so this one was not isolated. The hotel is located on a side street which makes it very difficult to get a taxi in the rain, especially. The rooms are small, even by NYC standards and clearly by Doubletree standards. Perhaps the most disturbing problem is that we waited between 5-15 min. for an elevator. The hotel personnel acknowledged that the elevators were a problem. In additon, we came back to the hotel at around 1 am and a hotel service employee would not let guests into the elevator when it came because he needed to take hotel supplies upstairs. I have never seen guests treated this way by hotel personnel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, highly recomended”
Reviews.Author: Hiltongold
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in the downtown area with good proximity to the MTA subway to get to Midtown. The rooms were clean ,the staff was very friendly and the morning breakfast buffet was a treat as well. If another elvevator could be added or stairs to the second floor Front Desk it would improve the time spent waiting for the elevaors.

Reviews.Title: “All Great Except Elevators”
Reviews.Author: WanderingEarthling
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small but very modern, clean, and well appointed. They did a great job with the space they have. The issue is the elevators. There are only 3 and you have to wait a long time for one. And by "long time" I don't just mean a few minutes. There is no air conditioning in the hallways on the guest room floors, so waiting for a long time for an elevator with no air conditioning in July is a challenge. Make sure you aren't in a rush when you head out, and give yourself plenty of time to get downstairs. Other than that, this is a great hotel in a great location. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: rmajumdar36
Reviews.Content: Based right on the south tip of Manhattan, this hotel is a more than adequate place for those who like the area and don't wish to pay the earth for a room. Good service, a nice little gym, a tirelss concierge and decent 4 star rooms. Good value and a nice experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “ItÂ´s just ok!”
Reviews.Author: MunterDam
Reviews.Content: We spent our last two nights in New York in the Doubletree by Hilton NYC - Financial District. There is no shuttle bus from Newark airport to the hotel so getting there is a bit tricky. If you don't want to pay the taxi fee of 80$ from the airport to the Hotel you can take the subway BUT maybe it is not such a good idea if you are carrying heavy bags with you since many train stations in New York lack elevators and escalators. The reception area was small but the staff was very professional and helpful. We got the famous doubletree warm chocolate cookie witch by the way taste like it sounds â€¦ very good:) We lived on the 26th floor and our room was smartly furnished with a safe, ironing board, flat TV and a working desk (area). The coast for the wireless internet is around 10$ for 24 hours it was not included in our package when we booked our room. The breakfast was ok! It was fresh but very small selection. You can get some fresh fruit, corn flakes , coffee, tea, bagels, eggs, some pastries but that is pretty it. Over all it is a good hotel but I would probably not book it again. The positive: - Helpful staff - Clean room with a good Hilton standard - Near the cruise to Elis Island - Complimentary business center great to print out boarding ticket The negative: - No shuttle bus from and to airport. - Small breakfast - Too noisy because of the heavy New York traffic so it was difficult to get a good night sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good area, rubbish hotel”
Reviews.Author: berko2k
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in July in this hotel. Firstly the room was not clean the bedding was dirty and had hair in it-that wasn't ours. The air conditioning roared all night I appreciate that all ac units make a noise but this was like a low flying plane. The staff are false and not interested in helping- the concierge look at you like you are something he trod in and grumbled about people using the 'free' wifi-it's only free in the lobby. The only staff who were friendly and helpful were the doormen who were able to tell me where to eat and which subway to get after the concierge was too busy chatting to the reception staff. I'd promote them any day!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny, hard to find, but nice”
Reviews.Author: Wade266
Reviews.Content: I am used to small rooms in NYC, but I swear I could knock on my door while standing on the elevator. As another post mentions, the elevators are slow. Odd set-up with reception on the second floor. Be advised that Stone St is very short - about 2 blocks, and not contiguous! Our cab driver had trouble finding it. Whitehall subway (N, R) is across the street (nice) and Bowling Green (4, 5) and the famous Wall St bull are a block away. American Indian Museum is at the end of the block, but I wouldn't bother - its a huge building with basically one small gallery.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: McClau21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree in May for 4 days and were not disappointed about our choice. I normally go to NYC at least once a year and never stayed in the financial district. Although it is not the busiest and â€œhappeningâ€� neighborhood it is the perfect location to stay. Very close to the beautiful south seaport and especially close to many subway stations which will take you anywhere: N, R, Q, 1, 4, 5 lines are at a 5 minute walking distance. The rooms are clean, comfortable bed; however the rooms are very small. That being said who goes to NYC to sleep? There is wireless internet in the rooms. The concierge service is great. The two main problems we found were the elevators: they are very small and it can take a while before you can get in (not enough elevators for the amount of floors) and the hotel reception; again very narrow, difficult to register with your luggage. Staff if pleasant and friendly, we didnâ€™t try the restaurant as it seemed to be overpriced. The gym is small with about 6-7 cardio machines however not too bad for a hotel gym and very clean (towels are available at the gym). Mainly for the location and the overall price vs quality we highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: travel_incognito1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business trip where I needed to primarily be downtown. This was a great location. I did take one trip up to Midtown and the subway stop is right around the corner - VERY convenient. The hotel rooms are nice. Stayed in a room with two double beds and didn't feel too cramped. Nice shower and bathroom. The sink has very little counter space but its manageable. Staff is friendly and helpful. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Location”
Reviews.Author: mikeycee0630
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel in a quiet location in downtown Manhattan. Rooms are nice (small) and the beds are very comfortable. The elevators are miserable as there are only three - it's better off taking the steps depending on what floor you are staying. We only stayed one because we needed a place to crash after a long flight from Istanbul - wasn't our favorite hotel we've stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied with our stay.”
Reviews.Author: chies1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree at Financial District last weekend. Overall, we are very happy with it. Location is great since it is next to Battery Park, and it is still quite quiet. Rooms are not big, but it's big enough. Everything inside feels expensive for its class. I didn't know Doubletree gave out warm chocolate chip cookies after check-in and I admit, I already like the hotel from then on. The only thing that is not that great is the wait for the lift. Three lifts are serving 40+ floor even though the floors are small. When i check out one lift was not working. Since we have a baby stroller and luggages, we waited for a long time before there is a lift that have enough space for us. Also, internet is still not free. However overall, it was a very enjoyable stay and I will recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD ROOM, GREAT LOCATION, AMAZING STAFF”
Reviews.Author: MNChurch
Reviews.Content: DATES/NIGHTS: 01/11 â€“ 04/11 â€“ 54 nights OVERALL: A great location right in the middle of the Financial District in lower Manhattan. The hotel was almost brand new when I stayed there and was in pristine condition. Overall I would give this hotel the highest ranking possible, however, if you have never stayed in New York City hotel before there are a few things that are â€œuniqueâ€� to the experience. And I am not mentioning these things as a way of complaining, but mentioning them because they actually add to the ambiance of the hotel. First, there are only 3 elevators and 44 floors. So if youâ€™re on a high floor make sure you leave a few minutes early because it will take you awhile to get to the lobby, and itâ€™s even busier on the weekends. And on each floor the hallways are very narrow so if you are traveling with equipment for work or large luggage it will be tricky navigating to your room. There is one restaurant on site, 8 Stone, which I only ate at once because it was slightly expensive and I get a daily per Diem for food. But the meal I had there was amazing and was completely worth the price so if youâ€™re not concerned about price you will find some delicious options here. STAFF: Before I arrived at the hotel I called ahead and asked if there was a mini-fridge in the room because I needed one as I travel with medication. I spoke to Michele who works the front desk and she said that none of the rooms have one but she would see what she could do for me. In no time I received an email confirmation that they did not have any on site but they would have another Hilton hotel send one over for me specifically. I have never had a Hilton staff member do something like that for me before. And on my second 9 night stay she upgraded me to one of the suites even though they only have 5 of them for no reason other then to be nice. But the most amazing thing that the front desk staff did for me for offer me a special unpublished rate which was considerably lower then when they could have gotten for the room. And by doing this I was able to stay in Manhattan for my entire time there and did not have to move over to a cheaper hotel in Brooklyn. With all honestly I can say that, as a whole, the staff at this Doubletree was the best I have ever come across. And I spend over 200 nights a year in Hiltons all across the country. With staying there as long as I did I eventually had everyone from the security officers and bell hops at the front door, to the maintenance staff, to the servers and manager in 8 Stone, to the general manager addressing me personally every single time I they saw me. I was always treated with the upmost respect and professionalism by 99% of the hotel staff. Unfortunately that does leave 1% of the staff, and that 1% is the front desk manager, Elvi. Of all the Hiltons I have stayed at and of all the employees I have come to know I have NEVER been treated as poorly as I was by Elvi. But Michael, the General Manager of the hotel, personally handled the situation to my full and complete satisfaction, so all I will say about that is try to avoid Elvi. But if you do need anything at all from the front desk make sure you find Michelle or Michael and you wonâ€™t ever be disappointed. And if you need anything from the restaurant make sure you find Joshua, the finest manager in all of New York City. ROOMS: The rooms are all standard and there are only a few suites. The rooms are very nicely decorated and the beds, pillows, and blankets are extremely comfortable. But the rooms are also pretty small and the bathroom and shower are really cramped. The suites are slightly larger and have a â€œliving roomâ€� area with a couch and second flat screen TV. But for New York City the rooms are on par with what youâ€™d expect to find so itâ€™s not a big deal if you keep that in mind. Your best bet is to get a high floor and try to get an â€œ08â€� room because they are shaped in a way where you get a little more space by the door and these are the biggest non-suite rooms they have. Also, the higher you get the less street noise youâ€™ll hear. Another nice little extra is that the window actually opens so you can let in fresh air as well as the sounds of the city if you want them. And two other small little things that frequent travelers will appreciate is that the hotel offers a large amount of TV channels and multiple HBOs and the best part is that the TV actually has a guide that you can bring up and scroll through to find what you want to watch and not waste an hour surfing every channel looking for something to watch. And finally, keep in mind that unlike most Doubletree Hotels there are no mini-fridges or microwaves standard in the rooms. But I was told that the hotel does now keep a few on hand in case someone requests oneâ€¦ so you can thank me for that later! AREA: What else can you say but WOW! Walk out the front door and youâ€™ll be in front of the NY Stock Exchange, or the Wall Street Charging Bull, or Battery Park, or the Staten Island Ferry in 3-4 minutes at the most. Youâ€™re also less then 10 minutes away from the World Trade Center site and the South Street Seaport. There are two subway lines nearby, one on the corner and one over in Battery Park that will get you anywhere in the city you need to go. You can be in Times Square in 12 minutes flat. The only negatives are the Pubs near Wall Street are very popular and thus, very busy and very expensive. There arenâ€™t a lot of quality reasonably priced places to eat beyond these within walking distance. So your best bet is to get an unlimited subway card and head north. But the one Saving Grace is that Lombardiâ€™s actually delivers to the hotel and it gets there super fast and super hot and fresh, but they only take cash. ELITE BENEFITS: The biggest benefit is the free breakfast buffet down in 8 Stone for elite members. The buffet isnâ€™t bad but it also isnâ€™t amazing. They offer fresh fruit, eggs, pancakes, meats, breads, and cereals. Itâ€™s great for shorter stays but when youâ€™re there for 9 straight mornings at a time and over 50 mornings in all anything would start to get boring. Juice is free but soda is not and neither are the refills. Youâ€™ll also get free wireless in your room which always worked well for me. WOULD I STAY AGAIN OR RECOMMEND: 100% YES! You will find that for its location this is going to be one of the most affordable brand names in New York City. The staff is AMAZING and the hotel is beautiful. But the hotel is designed for short stays and not extended ones but they will do their best to accommodate and cater to you no matter what.

Reviews.Title: “Great business value”
Reviews.Author: OrbExplorer
Reviews.Content: This is my regular hotel when I travel to NY, which is probably 3 times per month. It is very close to our office on Water St, and that makes it really appealing. Additionally, we have great rates which helps keep costs down. The hotel is new and built in the past year. There is a decent restaurant downstairs and room service is good. The lobby is on the second floor so you have to take an elevator to get there. Check-in is always fast and they give you an excellent warm cookie! There are three elevators and they can be very slow. I have waited 2-3 minutes sometimes for one to come. The rooms are small but efficient. I am always alone, so it's not an issue. With two people and multiple bags, this could get very tight quickly. The bathrooms too are small with limited shelf space. The shower seems small too, but they have good water pressure and a large shower head. The air conditioner in the room is loud and not always easy to regulate. It can wake you up on occasion because it's so loud. Great TV and channel selection. There is a coffee pot in room and efficient room service. Internet is available for a fee, unless you have status and then it's free. As a business traveler, this is a good hotel and close to work. I would recommend it for this purpose. I would offer 3.5 stars if they let me.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, quiet.. leave extra time for the elevators”
Reviews.Author: YYZtotheworld
Reviews.Content: Great experience at this hotel. Front desk staff very friendly and check in process painless. Small number of rooms per floor make it relatively quiet, as does the location (on Stone Street, not far from Wall Street but very little traffic through the night). Other hotels in the Financial District (Millenium Hilton, Marriott, etc) tend to be noisy due to ongoing construction at World Trade Center site. Am sensitive to noise and this hotel was very quiet. Room itself small, but not any smaller than usual New York rooms. Nice bathrooms with high end fixtures (also I noted an exhaust vent - unusual for a hotel but helpful to get the steam out!), bed was very comfortable. TV had a surprising number of HD channels. Air conditioning system was very noisy to start up (to the point I ended up turning it off as it was cycling on and off all night, waking me up each time). Disappointing that Hilton has chosen not to extend the usual "free wi-fi" courtesy that is normally found in the Doubletree family. While the business lounge offers free access, it would have been much more convenient had it been included in the room rate. The main reason this hotel only gets a 4 star is the terrible elevator service. It doesn't look it from the outside, but this is a 40+ story building, served by 3 elevators. I ended up taking the stairs a few times as got impatient with the elevator. Would certainly stay here again and recommend it to my colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Everything's new but SLOW elevators.”
Reviews.Author: spetron
Reviews.Content: This is a great spot in the financial district. Very convenient to subways, battery park, stock exchange, restaurants, bars, etc. The place is still like new. The rooms are all a good size and have everything you need. I've stayed here about half a dozen times now and really haven't been disappointed. Very clean. Reasonable space. Many rooms have great views (higher floors). The food is good and all the staff are really great. My only issue with this place is the elevators. You can easily spend 5-15 minutes, depending on the time of day, waiting for an elevator. So you need some patience. Great spot for business travelers who need to be near Wall St. Also, great for tourists who want to be away from mid-town activity but close to all subways and lots of great historical sights.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bettylou1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. Very nice stay. Clean room... nice staff.. cozy beds. All of the important things! :) It is very close to the subway and not a bad walk to world trade center. We will definately come back! Kids loved the cookies at checkin. We did not go to the restaurant. There is a italian restaurant across the street Ancora... it was soooo good.... pricey but excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: hoochy1
Reviews.Content: stayed here for our first trip to NY, compared to the other hotels within NY, very reasonably priced. Stay very friendly. Room very clean and snug! But everything you need as didnt spend much time back at the room. Few mins walk from bronze raging bull, Battery park, which is where the boats leave for Liberty and Ellis Island trips. Hotel also near the metro. Near to Wall street (which has a tiffany's half way along) and Trinity Church. Only a 10 min walk from World trade centre site. Great american breakfast in georges, which is rector/greenwich street. Yummy. Loads of starbucks so if your a coffee addict, then yr in heaven. Would stay again at the hotel. When you check in you get a free warm cookie which was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and would stay again...”
Reviews.Author: Happy2TravelSC
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. We chose the hotel based on a decent price for NYC hotels and we were interested in a different location than midtown. Overall, our experience was very good...the room and bathroom was clean and comfortable. Others commented about the size of the room, but we had 2 double beds for 2-3 people and that was adequate. A couple of issues of note: The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, with the exception of the concierge. We had inquired about some information that we were trying to obtain, and he was really just trying to sell us tickets to various tourist attractions. As we are very familiar with NYC and have visited several times, we pretty much knew what we were asking, and made to feel as though we didn't know anything about the city! The other issue was having a room across from the elevator. The hallways were quite narrow, so most rooms were near elevators. The first night I could hear people getting off/on and the 'ding' of the elevator. I guess I was able to tune out eventually. The last issue was the TV. There was all kind of tweaking and hitting of various buttons on the remote to get it to work. Other than those three issues, we had a very nice stay and would gladly return. We also really liked the location, which was away from the crowds in midtown.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay there again”
Reviews.Author: featherfamily
Reviews.Content: Location was fine, rooms were very small even for NY, and suffered from awkward uses of space. Hardly any space to get ready, lack of counter space in bathroom. This could have been overlooked, however, there were bigger problems. My issue was 1) the bathroom smelled like a sewer all the time 2) the room was not cleaned regularly; only once in our three day stay 3) the time the room was cleaned, the generous tip we left was taken, but so was an article of clothing that I had just bought. The staff promised my husband to look into this but nothing happened. Would NOT stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: tullajoyce
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, lovely breakfast, would recommend it to anyone and would defo stay there again....... Easy access to underground going, mid town or up town. Lovely area, walk around, down by sea front. Lovely restaurants especially across the road from hotel an Italian, very funny night in there, look for Antonio Fantastico.....

Reviews.Title: “Honey they shrunk the hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrlDsguise
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree is a nice enough hotel - just everything in it is smaller compared to most of the other NYC hotels I have stayed at. Small rooms, hallways and elevators (a total of 3 of which service 46 floors). I go to NYC on weekends about six times a year on average, and often stay downtown at the Millenium Hilton which is supersized compared to the Doubtletree downtown and usually in the same price range. Despite a good location I can't say I will go out of my way to stay there again. In addition to the small room the sink had some major cracks and the door between our room and the next did not fully close or lock, other than the inside latch. I would stay there again if the price was right but there are better options in the Hilton Family.

Reviews.Title: “Big price small room”
Reviews.Author: Belgo43
Reviews.Content: Top marks for location in lower Manhattan - ideal for financial district, subway stations and ferries to Statue of Liberty Staten Island etc. And it's clean. But the building is obviously not built to be a hotel and is not ideal. Breakfast room is tiny (there was a huge queue one morning when a big group arrived), reception is not on the ground floor, you have to wait forever for a lift (elevator), and the rooms are small with shower and no bath. The Doubletree gimmick of giving you a hot chocolate cookie on check-in, when you have lots of luggage to handle, is crazy (a complimentary bottle of mineral water in the room would be much more useful).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: Laiska
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week in April 2011. hotel is very clean and in good condition. We were given a non-smoking when asked, even though we had booked smoking. Asked for high floor too, which was not a problem. Good service! Room was very new and in great condition. Bed was very comfy, as written in here earlier too. Room didn't have any spare space, but was acceptable. Our stuff fitted in and there was enough room for 2 person for 7 days. Can't be that small then. View was nice facing the Wall Street area. 32" flat TV with huge free selection. Had breakfast every morning which was basic with eggs & bacon and pancakes. Bread and yogurt with fruits was available too. Didn't eat or drink outside breakfast time so can't comment on that. Location was great. Subway R is 50 meters from hotel door and lines 4 & 5 around 100 meters. Cab fare to anywhere in Downtown shouldn't be more than 10 USD. South Ferry terminal to Staten Island is around 200 meters away.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Alternative to the Busy Bustle”
Reviews.Author: kimerik
Reviews.Content: Overall we were very pleased with this hotel. We Chose to stay in the financial district as opposed to other parts of the city because it was Easter weekend and prices were through the roof. We paid $199.00 a night for a room with two doubles. Pros: This hotel is very clean, well maintained and the staff is very friendly and helpful. It is very easy to park when staying at this hotel and the valet/self park options are very reasonable. This is a quiet part of town on the weekend but there are still plenty of restaurants and sights to see if you don't want to go far. Cons: While the rooms were very clean and the beds were very comfortable, it is impossible to get around the room swiftly. The space between the desk and the bed is very narrow and the bathroom is very cramped. Also, don't count of catching a taxi outside of the hotel- you will have to walk a few blocks to be seen. This hotel is tucked away, and while there is a subway stop about 20 steps away, taxi rides can be costly if you are going back and forth from midtown. To sum it all up- a great buy for a short stay especially if you don't spend a lot of time lingering in the room.

Reviews.Title: “If you want a good night's sleep, DO NOT stay here”
Reviews.Author: satchell88
Reviews.Content: I am a business traveler and rarely write reviews or complain. I usually stay at Starwood or Marriott properties but decided to give Doubletree a try. To sum it up, do not stay at this hotel unless the only thing you care is the location. If you have other comparable options, go with one of them. My main complaint is the room quality and the amount of noise. The rooms are small, and just about all of them are near one of the three elevators. The walls are thin, and many rooms have that adjoining door to the room next to it. I stayed there Mon - Friday for business, and could hear every single peep from the room next to me and from the hallway. I was woken up multiple times early in the morning 3 out of the 4 days by the traffic in the hallway, children screaming, and the neighboring room's alarm clock. Upon checking in, I asked for a different room but they said the hotel was full, and that I was lucky I didn't get an -03 room because those are really noisey. Upon checkout, I explained the noise issues and they took my number to have the manager call me. Surprise, he never called. In addtion, this hotel has literally the slowest elevators of anywhere I have ever stayed. On average, I would say the wait is at least 5 minutes for an elevator every single trip. The elevators are routinely full and cramped, and they stop at about 6 floors per trip. Also, the hotel restaurant, Eightstone, is not very good. Normally I wouldn't have tried it, but hey, I was desparate. Long story short, there are much better options for same or less price in financial district. If you stay at Doubletree, at least bring your ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: serenity033
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small, quite comfortable and stylishly furnished. I agree with the other reviews about the slow elevators, which can be an annoyance, and the heating/cooling equipment in the wall which cycles on and off. If a light sleeper, it will keep you awake. Lucky for us, the weather was warm enough to turn off the equipment and the constant ventilation air served as "white noise" so room was insulated against street noise. If you are a jogger, you are only a few blocks from the Hudson waterfront paths.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for NYC”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoChik77
Reviews.Content: I had a quick stay in NYC for a weekend. I came to see friends and to shop. The hotel is ideally situated in that it is near to the trains and cab ride away from other areas like SoHo, Flatiron, Meat-packing, etc. It is in the financial district, so for the most part it was rather quiet for the weekend, but the nearby places such as starbucks, duane reade, chipotle, etc were still open. (yes, starbucks is a 30 second walk away!) Would probably stay here again. Rates were reasonable, hotel is new-ish, accomodations were small but that's NYC for ya.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in NYC, totally new hotel,quiet , very clean and confortable. Good situation”
Reviews.Author: Oscar-from-France
Reviews.Content: Excellent. very recent hotel with nice bedroom. Very clean with nice and modern bathroom with pleasant shower (no bath but we don't need it). Perfect breakfast with all that we need. Only one small problem : the key didn't work well to open the door in some bedrooms. But we think they will repair this, maybe too recent keys system not well installed ! Very good situation in Financial District near Wall Street, pleasant because it is quiet. Rare in NYC ! Subway is very close and we don't need a long time to go to Midtown. Very convenient to go to the Statue of Liberty. A very good hotel in NYC

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great.......Until the very end”
Reviews.Author: AustinDMD
Reviews.Content: Ok, so I am giving this hotel 5 stars, because I hate when people give a great hotel 2 stars just because something didn't go exactly their way during their stay. It doesn't give the reader a fair overview of the hotel. So, let me tell you all about the good of the hotel and then I will give my one complaint at the end. Rooms: Small, but laid out well and comfortable. Stylishly decorated. Big window. Modern bathroom with GREAT shower. Extremely comfy beds. Overall Great! Reception: Very friendly, eager to please. Great warm chocolate chip cookies at check in. Location: To each their own, but we loved it. We come to NY every year and we know our way around very well. We love downtown versus times square area. 2 subway stations within a 60 second walk. 4/5 lines and the R line with the 1 line. Make sure to walk down to 62 Stone Street (same street) to Financier Patisserie for breakfast or afternoon snack. It's a French-style cafe. Here goes for my one complaint: On the AM of us leaving, I called Reception and asked for a "cab" to the airport. They said "sure, we will call one for you, when do you need it"....So, we get down to the street and this nice SUV is waiting. I knew right away they had called a "limo" service. I was told by the driver that it was $50 flat fee to LGA airport. Would have been only about $20-25 with a metered cab. By that point, we didn't have time to do anything else. Had to take the limo to make our plane on time. It would have been very nice for the hotel to tell us about the fee for the limo before ordering it. Especially since he only took cash, thank goodness we had enough cash on us. (versus metered cabs who take cards)......to make it worse, found out later that the hotel gets a $20 cut on EVERY limo car they call for a customer. That made my blood boil............Just warning others for future visits. Now I know for next time! :) You live and learn....... I would stay here again despite the limo incident. It was an overall great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean modern hotel. Location better than expected.”
Reviews.Content: The room was a pretty good size, bigger than I was expecting. It was clean, modern and the king size bed was very comfortable. Didn't really use the hotel facilities so can't comment on them. Location in the financial district turned out to be much more convenient than I was expecting. Less than a five minute walk to the Statten Island ferry terminal and the subway. Biggest downside was lack of free wireless in the room - you either had to trek to the lobby for free service or fork out about $10 for 24 hours. Otherwise the price we paid felt like good value. It probably costs a lot more in peak season though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice price”
Reviews.Author: ElaBizz
Reviews.Content: We got to this hotel and had a good deal on the internet. 150$ a night on Expedia. Best part of the stay: we get there and they give us 2 rooms for that price! My friend and I wew were not looking forward to sleeping in the same bed and without asking anything...they gave each of us a room. Thank you to the really nice people at the check in counter. Nice, professionnal, super griendly. We checked our room for bed bugs...nothing everything was super clean! Everyone was nice at this hotel as soon as you walk in the door all the way to the check out.. Try to go for a walk around the back of the hotel to the historical street....beautiful little bars and cafe...nice restaurant. All in all a great hotel in NYC. We will sure check in the next time we are in town.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible staff, gorgeous rooms”
Reviews.Author: Anne311
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Doubletree Financial District could not have been more kind, responsive, attentive, or gracious -- even when I was a bit annoying! Manager Josh was particularly kind, and ran a really strong team all around -- I felt absolutely taken care of and welcomed. I couldn't believe how luxurious the room was, especially for the price I paid. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone coming to NY. Thanks to everyone at the Doubletree Financial District for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, nice looking Hotel but very noisy at night with security eventually sorting out the problem guests”
Reviews.Author: Jimmershaw
Reviews.Content: On checking in my first impressions of the hotel were very good. The location of the place is a plus due to its quiet side street setting. Reception staff are polite, friendly and assured me that I would get a great nights sleep (little did he know). The rooms are very small but are well maintained, modern,clean and well equiped with a nice flatscreen tv etc. The bathroom is great and was spotless. The downside of the stay was the general noise. The corridors are very small, cramped and I was constantly woken by doors slamming, people talking loudly and antisocial behaviour. Having gone to sleep at about 10 I was woken by noisy guests coming in and out of the lift. This lasted for about half an hour and then I drifted back to sleep only to be woken again by more people and noise in the corridor. I eventually opened the door to find a small group of people lying drunk by the emergency exits. I called security who eventually came but the group had left. Same thing happened 15 mins later and by this time I was fully awake. Security was called again and dealt with the issue. Overall the hotel was very good but I suffered at the hands of some very noisy guests and think that security could have reacted quicker.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great staff, nice rooms, historic location.”
Reviews.Author: Neptune318
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a five night stay in this new hotel. It proved to be one of the best lodging experiences I have in nearly six years of traveling to NYC. This new hotel features clean rooms with comfy beds. The staff are friendly, helpful, and professional. Great location with R train access across the street and 1/4/5 train access one block away. Situated at the intersection of historic Battery Park/Bowling Green/Financial districts. Nice bars and restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Cold and not particularly great value”
Reviews.Author: NYTraveller_11
Reviews.Content: May be this review was influenced by the adverse weather New York has just experienced but the hotel was definitely challenged by the cold conditions. Starting from the beginning, I have been visiting New York on business for the last 10 years and was keen to try this new hotel in the financial district having stayed at all the other local hotels. The Doubletree's location is good and, being on the first part of Stone Street means it does not suffer undue street noise. Also on the positive side was the size and quality of the shower in the bathroom (NB there are no baths) and the wide choice of TV Channels in the bedroom, all of which could be viewed clearly without interference. Like other nearby hotels, it was clean and the bed was comfortable. Turning to the not so positives, the hotel is over 44 floors and has nearly 400 bedrooms. However, they are served by only three (fairly slow) lifts which could be very frustrating at peak times once the hotel gets booked up. Downstairs, the ground restaurant has little ambience and is only rated for 55 seated of which around ten would be in a conservatory off of the restaurant. The latter also doubled as the area where the breakfast buffet was laid out. With sub-zero temperatures outside, this area was very cold indeed at breakfast time. The bar and restaurant area is also far smaller than the nearby Marriott, Andaz and Millenium Hilton hotels. Moving up the building, I was staying with a number of colleagues on different floors. From our collective experience, on the lower floors, the communal hallway areas were cold with the hotel warming up the higher you went. However, this benefit in heat was offset by an increase in extraction noise via a vent in the ceiling of the bathrooms from the communal building ventilation system. A number of colleagues closed their bathroom doors at night which cured the noise but also meant the bathroom was then not heated (all heating is supplied by a single wall mounted fan under the window of the bedroom). Basically a choice between noise and comfort. For a hotel of this price in the financial district, it is also very unusual to have wall mounted fan heaters at all. Normally, it is via ducted heating/AC in the bedrooms. As a consequence, in cold weather (and presumably the reverse also being true for AC in the summer), your sleep is disturbed by the fan switching on and off to maintain temperature. Being a relatively light sleeper, I switched mine off at night which resulted in a cold start to the day. The bedrooms are the smallest I have stayed in locally which would not necessarily be a problem if the tariff was substantially less than the other hotels listed above. However, when we booked, it was comparable which, for us would be a deciding factor in looking to book again. Overall, I would suggest only going for this hotel if the tariff quoted gives a good saving over and above the Downtown Marriot or the Andaz on Wall/Water Street.

Reviews.Title: “Top Marks- Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jdhammer
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights for business. The hotel was 200 yards from the office door which made commuting a breeze. My room was small but beautiful, great facilities, nice decor and a really comfy bed. It was immaculate every day when I came back. The bar was open til 11 and they will deliver up to your room. The free breakfast was great, really classy restaurant, great selection of hot food and great service. It really appealed to me as an alternative to slugging through the snow to Au Bon Pain. The elevator situation was my only annoyance. There are 44 floors and only 2 elevators, so be prepared to wait. And the Financial Dist is dead at night, but Stone Street is only 2 blocks away, many of their restaurants are open til 3. Highly recommended though, and really great value!

Reviews.Title: “Brand new with Reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: Happytravelinfamily
Reviews.Content: New property. Price was right and the rate included breakfast. Overall pleasant stay

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel and fantastic friendly service!!”
Reviews.Author: Sunseekertam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for news years eve and new years day as it was cheaper than times sqaure and we are so glad we did! Hotel lobby was gorgeous and staff very friendly.Handed a warm cookie on arrival which was a lovely touch.I hate lifts so to be put on the 33th floor was my idea of hell so they changed me to floor 6 which was perfect.Rooms are stunning.Bathrooms are so modern with a massive walk in shower with a huge waterfall shower head.Tv channels are endless and the bed is one of the best it wassoooooo comfy i didnt want to get out of it!!!Coffee making machine was quirky and a nice touch.Breakfast was included in the ultra low rate now this was the only tiny negative way too small for all the guests and didnt restock the bread etc quickly enough.The waiters were friendly especially josh and always topped up your orange juice etc but was just to crammed in and when the hotel is full full i think they will struggle with this.The prices for food and drink were just crazy so avoid this and go out to nearby restaurants and bars..becketts was anice one which is a stones throw away.All in all an excellent hotel with staff who have a smile constantly a friendly attitude which is unusual in new york compared to other service we recieved!! Def Def stay here you will not be dissapointed...I didnt want to leave!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Good Location, We Recommend It”
Reviews.Author: twstyle
Reviews.Content: Just got back from spending 3 nights in this brand new, "squeaky clean" hotel. The staff could not have been more accommodating, and we really enjoyed the location. Yes, the rooms are small, but it's Manhattan! We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with nice staff but slow elevators”
Reviews.Author: ccnhollywd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights for new years eve weekend. The hotel just opened on december 14th so it's brand new. the lounge area/ business center area is nice. it offers free wifi ( fee to have it in your room) and some lounge chairs and couches to lay back and surf the net. The rooms are tiny. I can't compare to other new york hotels in terms of space because i haven't visited in so long. i can say there was not enough floor space for myself and my friend to unfold our bags. definitely tight. the only complaint was the slow elevators. There are only three and they seem to take a long time. Definitely something you're not in the mood for after a late night out on the town. The bellmen were somewhat reluctant to get you a cab which i thought was interesting. My friend and i were leaving for the airport w/ bags and purses and the bellman suggested we walk to the corner to get a cab faster. hum? we were pretty weighed down with shopping bags, luggage and purses. Just didn't seem like the most ideal suggestion but then again i don't live in NY. Maybe they do it different there. All in all, it was a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and new, good for a downtown location”
Reviews.Author: wheljenn
Reviews.Content: Very nice room: small but very clean, modern, new. Heating unit a bit noisy at night. Staff was friendly and helpful. Great location for staying in the financial district - Bowling Green subway only about two blocks away.
